Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ready1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 140 for 3 nights, purchased our rooms direct and got reasonable prices. The clerk when we arrived was Israel and he was very knowledgeable of the area, recommended some great eats and sights. The rooms are small but very nice, I was there to sleep and shower. A great location for walking to the Boston Commons, Freedom Trail, Shopping on Newberry St, The Theater District or to take in a baseball game. .

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 140 during the "Back Bay Blackout". We were one of the first hotels to get our power back. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of many restaurants or only about 500 yards from a T station if you don't want to walk. The rooms are small but very clean. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it. In fact we have already recommended it to friends going to Boston this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & convenient”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I spend a couple of days at the 140; it's great value for its low fares. The hotel seems recently renovated, although everything is simple -no thrills. Staff is friendly and helpful. My room was very small but had a nice window; the bathroom is also small but quite comfortable for its size. Everything was reasonably clean. The location is very good, close to Copley Square, the malls and the shops at Boylston and Newbury streets. Complimentary wi fi works fine. I have no complais for this hotel and think it's a good alternative in Boston considering its price.

Reviews.Title: “Queen room”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: The building appeared to be a former YWCA and had some very cool historic pictures around the hotel. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfertable to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and Less Than Appealing”
Reviews.Author: basil409
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler and I like to try boutique and interesting hotels sometimes. This hotel was one of the few with rooms in Boston on the day I was there. Not a good pick for me. Parking and amenities were not adequate, room keys didn't work well, steps to get in the hotel (bad for carrying bags), rooms were small and the furnishings were below par. Won't use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the back bay”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 140 was by far the best value and location I've found in Boston. I travel to Boston frequently and will keep coming back here. Very courteous staff, easy to get to and from and the best nightâ€™s sleep Iâ€™ve had away from home. In the past Iâ€™ve paid three to four times as much per night for a lesser experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: mark_vi_
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking for a getaway to Boston for a few days and I stumbled across this hotel for the UNBELIEVABLE rate of $45 a night for a standard room. After reading a few of the reviews posted on tripadvisor, we booked the room.... we were not dissapointed. When we first got there, I was pleasantly suprised to find out they had upgraded us into a superior queen bed room and that there was a nearby parking lot where guests at the hotel get a discounted rate of 21-25$ per day of parking. On top of everything, there is free wi-fi offered at the hotel which is a nice bonus. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was also very clean with a standup shower. Bed was superb! The location of the hotel is really hard to beat. 5 minute walk to Copley square (which connects to the Prudential Centre) for shopping was very conveniant. 2 minute walk to the Back Bay Station which, through the commuter rail, gives you FREE access to south station, which puts you near quincy market and other touristy locations. We walked back to the hotel from quincy market and it only took us about 25minutes. There are very few negative things I can say about this hotel. However, the walls were very thin and we were able to hear other people's conversations through them. Secondly, whenever a toilet would flush (ours or others), there would be a loud thump in our room however this could have been just due to our room's location in relation to the pipes. Last, I found that a lot of light from the hallway would bleed into our room from the doorway (but a towel placed under the door helped). Overall the Hotel 140 is really hard to beat in regards to location or value. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SkykomishBob
Reviews.Content: I had to put in a cameo appearance at a conference at the Copley Westin where the rate was nearly three times as much, so I opted for the 140. Hard to imagine a better choice for a single traveler who'd much rather eat well and sleep cheap than vice versa. Clean, comfy, and excellent free wi-fi. It is particularly what I want in an hotel when I'm not vacationing. The two ladies behind the desk could not have been cuter nor more helpful. The bed was comfy. The bath adequate. The flat screen TV had a lot of channels. It's a very short walk from Back Bay Station, which is easy to get to via MTA from Logan Airport. It's only blocks from Newbury and Boylston Streets, which might matter to shoppers. Lots of good eateries nearby. The security takes some getting used to, since you need to slide your key card to operate the elevator just to get to the ice machine etc. but if you want value for money, it is easy enough to learn. I'll stay here again if I am ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, warm, and ideally located.”
Reviews.Author: KenC58
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an overnight stay during Boston's first snowstorm of 2012. Ideally located within steps of the metro T-stop. The receptionist was so accommodating and friendly and got us an upgraded warm room. The beds were so comfy. The bathroom was a bit small but adequate. I did not give 5 stars because the small refrigerator near my bed kept making clicking noises a few times at night.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel1996
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the basics for an overnight/weekend stay. It was overall clean and the check-in/check/out process was efficient. We had asked for a rollaway bed for our son, but when we got there we were surprised to receive an upgrade to two-doubles. The room was quiet and everything worked just fine. However, the water pressure was rather low. The only inconvenience was the mattress - rather worn-out, which gave us a poor-night's sleep. Parking was conveniently located next door, and hotel has discount arranged with them. Breakfast place not open on Sundays, but staff pointed us to other good alternatives around the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle F
Reviews.Content: Great location, cute rooms, great price, friendly staff. Could not have asked for anything more in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great, reasonable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room. Had a good, uneventful stay. Would stay here again and would reccommend it to friends. Park in the parking garage right next to the entrance. The entrance to the hotel is very understated.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. The location is very convenient, close to the Copley Station and Newbury Street which is nice. Bathroom is small and the lighting is atrocious. I had to drag in the a floor lamp each time to take a dump. This place will not get you laid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and super comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: Kahliya R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 140 back in Nov. My friend and I flew to Boston from Philly for only $100...I celebrated my bday weekend in Boston. We loved the hotel. I thought for the price I paid, that the hotel was very nice. We were impressed w/the comfort level of the beds. There was a fridge in the room as well (nice surprise). I would stay in this hotel again, if I go back to Boston. The rooms were basic but when you're in town to have fun and not stay in a room they serve the purpose. We also enjoyed how big the bathroom was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price! But only full size beds w/ shower”
Reviews.Author: sekingrn
Reviews.Content: LOve this location close to Back Bay station! Close to everything in Back Bay & green line. Front desk personnel were very helpful! Rooms are small but smartly designed. Very functional & totally acceptable for single travelers. Price is unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed and at the right price.”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler03_12
Reviews.Content: After looking at many hotels in the Boston area for a 3-night winter getaway, my boyfriend and I chose Hotel 140 because it was the best price and had a great location. I don't think we could have made a better choice. Upon check-in, the receptionist, Israel, told us we had an upgraded room, which was amazing, and was kind enough to provide a map and recommend some local places with great food. (Highlights were Thornton's for breakfast on a sunny morning and Trident Bookseller's & Cafe, where you must try the mushroom-fig sandwich.) We knew we didn't need five-star luxury, just a place to sleep, but were pleasantly surprised by a hotel that is clean, relaxing, and has very comfortable beds. The yellow hallways give the hotel a happy vibe, and the bathrooms are done in white tile that didn't have me questioning the cleanliness. The hotel has free WiFi, unlike some other local hotels that charge you. We had breakfast in the cafeteria downstairs and were happy with the good price and convenience. The hotel is about 200 feet from Back Bay Station on the Orange line, which was very convenient for taking Amtrak in, and about a quarter mile from Copley on the Green line. This made getting back very easy, even with unpleasant winter weather. The hotel is very close to Newbury Street, Trinity Church, and the Boston Public Library and within easy walking distance of the Prudential Center, Museum of Fine Arts, and the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, all of which I would recommend visiting. This meant we saved a lot of money by walking instead of taking the Subway. Overall, I would absolutely stay in this hotel again if I find myself in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: I had a second opportunity to stay at the Hotel 140 the week after Christmas. While my first stay earlier that month had been excellent, i was curious to see if my repeat experience would be as positive. It absolutely was. My request for a specific room was honored, largely due to the responsiveness of front desk representative Israel. He welcomed me back to the hotel, by name, and made sure that my reservation details were in order. He "gets it" when it comes to hotel hospitality and does much to promote this hotel. Part of the reason for my stay was to deliver gift basket items for my daughter and her fiance, who were arriving the following day for a stay that was a Christmas gift from my wife and me. Hotel manger Abraxas could not have been more gracious or accommodating as I worked on arrangements for their stay. She mailed me some items that I could wrap as a present and personally oversaw their reservation and room assignment. She made sure she touched base with me when I arrived to drop off the gift basket items. With one of the items being a bottle of wine, I was concerned about wine glasses. When I mentioned this to Israel, he assured me that they would find two glasses and have them in their room. He delivered, as promised. You might find more glamorous (and pricey) hotels in Boston, but I challenge anyone to find a hotel that is more committed to the satisfaction of their guests than Hotel 140. My most recent stay, as well as my daughter's experience, have convinced me that I can rely on consistent excellence from this hotel and their front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: tzitzi1981
Reviews.Content: We booked a Superior Room and upon our arrival, the receptionist Mr Israel gave us an upgrade to Queen Superior Room. The location is very central. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hailey L
Reviews.Content: The hotel 140 is in a prime location to walk or take the subway anywhere in the city. The staff is accommodating and the rooms are all unique. I have stayed there three times, and my favorite stay was in the very reasonably priced, Kennedy suite. This room has three rooms and a small stairway. The third room is huge with three beds! Any room is worth it here... Try the Hotel 140 and you will feel lucky to have found them!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: aro863
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The only complaint that I would have is that there was no sign outside that said it was hotel 140. This made it a little confusing to find in the dark, but otherwise no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Cozzy hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Tripnena
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 is just what you need for a business trip in Boston. Great location, just a couple of blocks away of the fancy hotels, you wont miss anything. The service is simply neat. Friendly front desk personnel. Daryl and Valerie were great and helpful! You feel pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Personalize Attention and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Jason06032
Reviews.Content: I just completed a three-night stay at the Hotel 140 in Boston. The entire experience was very positive. The location could not be better, very convenient to Copley Square, South Boston, Newbury Street, and the Public Garden.There are some great specials if you book through their Internet website. Communication from the hotel was great, including a confirming email a few days before my stay. Upon arrival, I was welcomed warmly by front desk representative Israel. He was friendly and efficient. When I called down a short while later to request a different room, he quickly accommodated my request. He even did a follow-up call to make sure everything was okay. He is an excellent ambassador for the hotel. The room was very comfortable and clean, but certainly not at the level of the larger Boston hotels given the reasonable rate, The shower was a bit small but a fair trade off for the price and location. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The personal attention, reasonable rate, and great location make this well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok space, intrusive staff”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: The space was appointed more for form over function, e.g., the shower was so small I could barely use it even though there was wasted space in the bathroom it could have occupied. Still the room was decent for the price and location. However, the staff was very intrusive, they demanded a mobile phone number on check-in for no good reason, called after I settled in with an obsequious and unnecessary "welcome" message that disturbed my rest, and the maid service attempted to enter the room in spite of the "do not disturb" sign. This intrusiveness made it a hotel I would not recommend or return to in spite of the reasonably ok physical space.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent -would defo go back”
Reviews.Author: Packing-lists
Reviews.Content: We were given a free room upgrade, the room was big & very clean. We had a fridge in the room which was very handy for drinks. Bed was big & comfy. Bathroom was very nice, clean & excellent shower. Staff were very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “been here before, and ill definitely come agian!”
Reviews.Author: danimx
Reviews.Content: we had stayed here lastyear too. we keep choosing hotel 140 because its cozy and has a nice homey feel. its convienent location was perfect because it was near the wilbur theatre and thats where we were heading that evening. the staff at the front desk were wonderful and very welcoming! we will definitely be back next year! the one downfall was the maid service..if you have a do not disturb sign on the door sometimes they dont see it and knock anyway and the toilets are so loud when theyre being flushed! you can hear ones down the hall from your room., but other than that it was wonderful! and when we arrived we had gotten a complimentary upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeBranch
Reviews.Content: Great position a few blocks from Copely Square - which was the stop for the on off bus. The staff were friendly and accommodating and although the rooms were small they were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable at a good price”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 is a nice clean, comfortable hotel at a price below most major chains. Good location in the back bay, close to Copley Square and easy walking to the commons and public gardens and downtown. This was our second stay at the hotel. Nothing fancy, but everything you need, including free Wifi. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough and low cost”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel 140 for two nights to attend a conference in Boston. I was pleased with the service. Our rooms were clean and cozy. There was free internet and a cafe downstairs, which had food to order, coffee, and drinks. On our last morning, we had to go to the airport, and there was a taxi waiting outside the door for us the moment we had to leave. My only complaint is that one of our rooms was somewhat small for three people. Stylistically, the rooms are not glamorous, but this place has a quaint charm to it. If you are looking for a place to rest in BackBay Boston, and don't want to pay ridiculous prices at corporate hotels, Hotel 140 is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, simple, friendly, great location and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: HHDXB
Reviews.Content: Having been upgraded on arrival I was delighted with the lovely spacious room. Having travelled in from NYC and stayed at a rally grotty hotel, it was lovely to be able to have a good pressure hot shower and sleep in a comfy, clean bed. Location was perfect - just around the corner from Copley Square and Prudential Tower and right next door to the BackBay train station, couldn't ask for better. The room rates were also fantastic. The staff upon arrival were super-friendly and helpful with what sights to see etc. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Boston. The Hotel itself isn't terribly fancy with posh restaurants, bars, bell boys and porters etc, but it does the job at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “queen room not so queen”
Reviews.Author: pattdf
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is very good, specially for the price and location, however the room we got was too small for two people, the bed is a queen which is not bad BUT on one side there is no night table, so forget about having anithing close to you at night, and the corners of the bed frame are murder, there's so little space to walk around the bed that my legs got the worst part, the bed is on the soft side so my back was not very happy. Nice staff, clean areas, efficient lift and good wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but clean, pleasant and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Kajillion
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews prior to staying at this hotel and apart from a few that were complaining about the place, I am repeating the others I read. It's totally fine (not fancy, rooms are small, etc.) and it is clean, and the location is absolutely perfect. It is literally 1 block from the Back Bay train station (orange line). No issues with the reservation...the only thing was they said it was a queen bed when in fact it was a double. They cleaned daily, were very pleasant, and the lobby/foyer is very inviting. There is a small cafe which serves basic breakfasts in the building. It seems to be in the same building as a YWCA but we never saw anybody entering that facility. I would totally recommend it again. Like I say, the location is fantastic. And the best tip I can make: purchase the week-long train ticket (at this time it is $15USD). We got our money's worth checking out this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room/good location”
Reviews.Author: dgolfer53
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. Yes, the room was small, but the location was excellent for shopping and sightseeing. Copley Sq. was just 2 blocks away as was Newbury St and all of the shops and great restaurants in that area.. Also very close(1 block) to the Back Bay train station. 5 stops on the T and you were at Quincy Market and the Harbor district. There were really no amenities in the hotel. We weren't going there to sit in our room and watch TV, so it really wasn't important.

Reviews.Title: “Charming lobby and building, great location; small rooms and minimal amenities”
Reviews.Author: zzvalika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late October of 2011, shortly after the electrical outages in Connecticut. It was a great find, in the heart of the city, in the backbay area but within blocks of newbury street and boston commons. The building itself is home to a small stage theater Lyric Stage, which adds to the charm. The building looks look a remodeled apartment building, with a nice spiral staircase in front, a small cafe, and a very pleasant looking lobby and counter. The ambiance is great. The rooms upstairs, however, were lacking. The bedsheets were minimalistic, the bathroom was small and the tiles were not flattering. The room was very small (150 sq ft), and there was no closet or desk - though, admittedly, there wasn't enough space for one. Furthermore, they listed on their website as having a workout room, but the room itself was smaller than our hotel room, and included one eliptical machine, and one bicycle machine. There was nothing else there. The price was amazing for the location, and we used an ipad app to get an even more reduced price for the night. Most boston hotels in that area, regardless of decor, cost twice as much as we were asked to pay. Given all that, we were more than happy with our stay, but the hotel is lacking in the more refined touches of some of the other downtown boston hotels that you might come upon in your searches. Overall very pleased with our stay and service.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for a room and didn't receive one.”
Reviews.Author: cdream
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with the Hotel 140 through BostonHotelseye.com 9 weeks before we arrived in Boston. When we got to the hotel the front desk clerk told us they didn't have our reservation. We showed her our printout and that's when the back and forth started. She assured us that Hotel 140 had never received the request and that she would have one of her managers looked into it for us. She suggested we go out for dinner while she worked on it. I had spent 10 hours in travel and felt a shower before a restaurant would only be fair to anyone sitting near me. Two hours later after we called BostonHotelseye.com, who assured us they most certainly did have confirmation of receipt of the reservation from Hotel 140, did the front desk clerk hand us a letter arranging a hotel room at a hotel 15 minutes away and send us out to a waiting taxi which Hotel 140 paid for. No one ever admitted a mistake and we had a two hour wait as well as needing to hop on the subway back downtown the next morning for our rental car which was a block away from the Hotel 140. The Charles Hotel where we were sent was very nice; the letter stating that the room cost $150 whereas we were charged on our credit card $232.95 for the non-existent room at the Hotel 140. Hmmm...

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dildanjon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during family weekend because could not find a hotel under 300 per night and was a little worried...but ended up pleasantly surprised. Rooms were modern and clean, bathrooms were on the small side and needed renovating..overall great value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 is relatively inexpensive; our room was small, but clean, and since we were there to see Boston and not lounge in the hotel, it was great. They had a good sized TV, and a nice glass shower enclosure when we needed to relax after a day of sightseeing. They also had free wi fi. We were able to rent a car next door, and the T was a block away. Staff were helpful in explaining the transit system, and we found that it was minutes to most things from the Back Bay area. The Stuart Street Grill downstairs had great coffee at breakfast, and hotel staff directed us to a great family restaurant for dinner- it had side orders of REAL VEGETABLES!!! I would stay there again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: skygirl340
Reviews.Content: Boston hotels are very expensive - you'll pay a lot for very little. Keep this in mind when you read some reviews on here which say that this hotel is over-priced, compared to other cities which demand lower hotel room prices some people may think this hotel is too expensive for what it is but for Boston it is excellent value. Shop around online to get the best deal. Great location - right beside the subway station and there is an Avis car rental right next door. Easy walking distance to various popular locations with lots of eating options in the area. The hotel was easy to find. The hotel staff were all pleasant and helpful. I had been worried that they wouldn't be because of some reviews I read on here. Perhaps some attitudes have changed as a result of comments made or perhaps some guests expect an over the top welcome (which you won't get). No problem what-so-ever with key cards as mentioned in other reviews. Lobby area is very nice looking. Our room was as I hoped it would be clean,safe, and a comfy bed. By American standards the room is on the smaller side but there is still plenty of space to walk around the room - we were 2 with 4 large suitcases and didn't have a problem. Room had everything you would need on a city break: hair dryer, toiletries, 'fridge, coffee maker, TV, phone, wardrobe. There was no in room safe which I do prefer to have in a hotel room but I believe they have safety deposit boxes or the option to put it in the hotel safe at reception. The bed was very comfy and I had a great nights sleep on all nights. Other hotel options in Boston are pricey and I don't believe the difference in price would be worth staying somewhere else, especially for us as when we are in a city we are out and about all day so really just need somewhere comfy and clean to sleep. If we come back to Boston we WILL be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: If you are happy with a clean hotel room with a comfortable bed for the night and are unfussed about space or fancy extras then you can't go wrong with Hotel 140. We were in Boston for 2 nights at the start of a tour of New England and wanted somewhere central where we could walk to the centre of town to see all the tourist attractions, but that also wouldn't break the bank. Was slightly worried having read a few of the reviews but needn't have been. Location is excellent and, considering this hotel was considerably cheaper than all the others in similarly good locations, we were very happy with our choice and felt that we would have wasted our money staying somewhere else at twice the price. I expected the room to be of a Travelodge standard (basic but clean with no extras) and some reviewers below have even made it sound like a hostel (I know it used to be one)! In fact, it was much better than that and I was pleasantly surprised with the standard of the furnishings etc. Yes, the room was small with little room to move around, but if you just want a bed for the night in somewhere decent then this doesn't matter. The free wifi was a big bonus. Didn't eat in the cafe for breakfast but handy to have. Ate at Skipjacks just across the street for dinner - would definitely recommend this for anyone, whether you want a smart meal or something more relaxed, as the food was excellent and not bad value we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Stimmo25
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel 140 and it was very good. The room was large and the bathroom very large. The bed and pillows were comfortable and it was quiet at night. The room had a fridge, coffee maker and the TV and wi fi were great. The staff were friendly and helpful - a small glitch with our bill was sorted out quickly. The windows could be opened for fresh air which was also a bonus. The biggest asset is the location. We arrived by train and it is right next to Back Bay station, which is also a subway station. There are great restaurants and shopping nearby and all the major attractions are within walking distance (or of course the subway if you prefer). We had a wonderful time in Boston and Hotel 140 is a great base to explore it.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job nicely”
Reviews.Author: Aeparker81
Reviews.Content: Happy with our stay here, not a hotel with pizazz, but not a massive building, a comfy bed in a good location and at a relatively good price that reflects other uses of building.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: skiingarchie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well located for Boston and Back Bay. There is an excellent good value cafe on the ground floor perfect for cheap breakfasts. There is also a good restaurant (Post 340) across the road. Staff on reception were helpful though I did find it annoying that they kept answering their phones when talking and dealing with me; it would have been easier to sort out any questions if i'd dialled down from the room! There is one thing, however, that I found annoying. Shortly before my stay I got an email from the hotel manager welcoming us and seeing if anything could be done before our visit. Whilst I thought this a nice touch, I noticed another email address was copied in to the email, one that I did not recognise and thought looked a bit suspect. Since then I've had a number of spam emails, one of which is from a Boston based company. I never give away my email address unless I have to and never sign up to newsletters etc. It's therefore no doubt in my mind that this suspect email address is responsible.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: karenelizabeth4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel 140 in early October. We were just in town for two nights to do a bit of sightseeing (and eating!). Neither of us had been to Boston before so we were looking for a nice, clean hotel that was convenient to everything we wanted to do, however, we didn't want to blow our budget. Hotel 140 was a great compromise in the Back Bay area. It was cheaper than other hotels nearby with more known names, but for the money provided a clean room with a comfy bed and flat screen television. The bathroom and shower were pretty small, but I wasn't expecting a luxury hotel, so we made do. The service was excellent and the staff were professional and courtious. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for the price and area!

Reviews.Title: “dungeon hotel 140”
Reviews.Author: josh L
Reviews.Content: Room is small without saying, but lack most of the ammenities a half decent hotels should have.There is no place for soap placement, have to leave it on the floor. Mimnimum number of lights; and dimly lit. Minimum of hooks in the bathroom, 1, to hang cloth, towel etc. Phone does not work. Every time youcall front desk it seems the operator hangs up on hearing any human voice. Double bed stuck at the corner and one has to craw over the other to get in and out of bed. Furnishing is 60ish, mattress soft and dip in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: Checked in Today, i ordered a superior Room and what I get is a very Small Room, Not possible to use for two People. They promise to make it better for tomorrow, we will See.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: courtandbrooke
Reviews.Content: We were very ha.ppy with our stay at Hotel 140. We priced lots of other hotels before choosing this one. All were much more expensive than this one. Our rate was around $150.00/night. Our family stayed at the Raddison a few blocks away and paid $250.00. The staff was VERY helpful. The room was small but spotless clean and had all the needed amenities...mini fridge, decent tv, tub/shower, coffee maker, hair dryer, good sheets, plenty of pillows, chairs. We had a king sized bed. We reserved a double bed but were upgraded when we checked in which was fantastic! We had a handicapped room which had a nice large bathroom. Most of the bathrooms are probably not that big. A great feature is the restaurant in the hotel. Must be good b/c there were lots of locals there. Deli-like food. This place's location is within walking distance of basically everything you want to see in Boston. Will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: huckcummings
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I expected the room to be miniscule, it was not. We were upgraded to a corner room, so possibly it was larger. The staff was friendly. Breakfast at the restaraunt was plain, but at a great price. Location is excellent, right next to T stop and 1 block from shuttle stop 8 on Old Town Trolley{ other trolleys use same stop}. A short hike to parking garage, which with hotel discount was $19 a day, I think. After pricing other options in Boston, I settled on this for price, and really didn't settle, it was fine. Also enjoyed a short walk to and dinner at Maggiano's see my review.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: teacher_syd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the basic room but upon check in we were upgraded to a larger room with a queen sized bed. There wasn't a coffee maker in the room...asked about it and there it was. The front desk has been very friendly and helpful helping us discover the best of Boston. Located a block from the subway is perfect for when you've walked all day and are just ready to be back in the room for a break. The Stuart Street Grill, attached to the hotel is also great...very inexpensive, fresh basic fare. Highly recommend Hotel 140 if you want a good, modest place to stay with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Price...”
Reviews.Author: vixen2333
Reviews.Content: Only 3 complaints/tips....the entrance to the lobby is small and there are stairs, and no place to unload your luggage from your car without double parking or parking illegally. Getting in and out without help or at a busy time is a pain. So pack light. Other complaint....the water pressure in the our shower was almost a trickle. I seriously thought about taking apart the shower head and removing the restrictor cap for the duration of our stay, I think I still have conditioner in my hair. Also rooms are super close together and walls are kind of thin, we could hear showers and toilets flushing next door, but guests were quiet. ON A GOOD NOTE: Room had a fridge, which was great. Room was clean and bed was comfy...could have used another pillow, but still comfy enough for the price. LOCATION: is perfect, right in the middle of EVERYTHING. Multiple T-Stops close by, greenspaces and Newbury Street are 2 blocks away. Definitely would stay here again when coming back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, 'ok' staff”
Reviews.Author: Christian1979NL
Reviews.Content: Staff seems preoccupied, did not feel welcome. Location is fine, rooms have thin walls so sleeping may be a problem. All in all an 'ok' place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aadewey
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing experience with this hotel and their management. We made a reservation to stay at this hotel. They charged my credit card in full upfront, which was surprising to me because it was not made clear that they would do so when I was making the reservation online. Four days before we left for our trip, my husband broke his foot and we were no longer able to travel across the country to Boston. I called the hotel immediately and spoke to a very nice front desk representative who said that because of the circumstances, I would be refunded within 48 hours. However, 48 hours went by and I was not refunded a cent. I left message after message trying to reach the sales coordinator and the manager. Three weeks later, they finally returned one of my calls and told me that there was nothing that they could do. Poor hospitality, horrible business ethics, and all around terrible experience. We will choose to take our business elsewhere next time we go to Boston. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: aircut666
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised Hotel 140 gets such mediocre reviews. The concubine and I booked a standard room in the full knowledge that it would not be palatial. In the event, when we arrived hot and bothered from our tussle with US Immigration and feeling like it was 3 in the morning, we were upgraded by our brighteyed receptionist to a quiet Superior King on the seventh floor. I wouldn't want a noisy Inferior Serf, but it was a decent room with a coffee maker and a shower that worked. The ground floor cafe is not to everyone's taste, but if you like your breakfasts fried, it's the place to go to line your stomach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; some things not so great.”
Reviews.Author: seatownsd
Reviews.Content: 3 best things about Hotel 140 are its relatively low rates, its great location--steps from Back Bay T station--and its spotless rooms. Rooms are smallish, but fine for 1 person. Wi-fi worked only intermittently & couldn't be fixed. Also, couldn't get a cell phone signal in my interior room at the bottom of an elevator shaft. All this made planning jaunts from my room next to impossible. Sure, there are plenty of wi-fi spots in the neighborhood; but who wants to have to go out to get a signal? Don't waste time or $$$ on the terrible, expensive food in the Hotel 140's "grill room"--there's a Starbucks 1/2 block away, & plenty of coffee bars, pastry shops, full-service restaurants & fast-food places within a few blocks. Hallways can be a maze: to get from my room to elevator, route was turn right, right again, then left, then 2nd left & cross your fingers. Staff was sometimes helpful & polite, sometimes indifferent. No exterior signing makes its hard to find the place. You have to look up the stairs, thru the small glass doors & behind the front desk to see "Hotel 140" & know you've arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small and YWCA?”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie0209
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews of this site.The rooms are far too small (reminds me of Tokyo) and the foyer was full of backpakers types when I was booking in from the YWCA.Breakfast wasn't on the day we were there and the only redeeming features of the hotel are the location and the staff were helpful.You can do better!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ghui
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite far away the main attractions in Boston and as a result we had to do lot of walking. It was about a 25 minute walk to Quincy Market. The hotel is clean but not particularly stylish or modern. I would describe it as average, nothing special but does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Not bad”
Reviews.Author: dng08
Reviews.Content: Locate in the Back Bay area, next to John Hancock Tower, 5 minutes walk From copley square and the T station (subway) holding the same name. Don't be mistake by hotel entrance, the rooms are very small (see picture), no table, no bath (just shower). Beside the room size, the rest is good enough for hotel in good location. Breakfast not included but available at reasonable price. The hotel is also home for low-income people but this is not bother. Free Internet (WiFi) in room. In the lobby there is free coffee all day. The staff were very polite and helping In the same block is Avis branch and not far is Hertz Branch as well. in the area are many good and famous boston restaurants. Taxi from Logan Airport cost Us 24 $ + tip.

Reviews.Title: “Location--the only redeeming feature”
Reviews.Author: museumgrl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many cities, most recently NYC, and I can honestly say I am astonished by the cost of staying at Hotel 140. The location is without question excellent. From the moment I walked into the sterile, almost down in the heels lobby, I had a foreboding feeling. The concierge was by herself and clearly overwhelmed by the combination of checking us into our room and dealing with the phone. Our instructions to find our room left a great deal to be desired. Thankfully, another guest explained to us what elevators to take. For $250 a night we had a cubbyhole with one bed and an outdated bathroom with a miniscule shower that resembled one from 1970. This was a YMCA and, aside from decent bed linens, this is a YMCA experience. Thank goodness our plan was to spend as little time in the room as possible. When a hotel room depresses my otherwise sunny-dispositioned 9 year-old, I know I had not done well in making the reservation. If I could have turned on my heels and rejected the hotel outright, I would have, but my husband would not have been pleased with that behavior. Thank goodness, I'm not my mother. If we had been with her, we would have rocketed out of this place in under five minutes before even arriving in our mushroom-colored YMCA bedroom we are now going to stay in for, blessedly, only one night. Spend a little more and stay elsewhere. That's my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of the Hotel 140. Don't get me wrong, it's nice. But you could stay down the street at the Hilton for the same price. The best thing about Hotel 140 is the location. It's pretty close to a lot of shopping, food and transportation. I think they share the same building as a YMCA. It makes for an interesting mix of people walking around. The rooms were clean and comfortable. But they're pretty small. Also, I was only there for a night and opted not to shower since it was so damn tiny. The decor reminded me of someones basement. I had to book a conference room for a few hours. It was fine. No water, pens or paper like you usually get at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An odd excuse for a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: papillon86
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a 2 1/2 week-long holiday in the US this summer. We found it to be overpriced for what it was, and the description of our deal to be misleading. BREAKFAST is the main problem here. They advertise on their website that continental breakfast is included. IT IS NOT. Upon arrival (Saturday evening) , we were informed that breakfast was not served weekends and that we were entitled to $5 each at the DUNKIN DONUTS (!!) around the corner from the hotel!! This fact is not advertised on their website, and when I brought this up with the receptionist, she stuttered and stammered her way through a repetition of what she had already told us. No explanation or excuse. On the 2nd morning, we went to the (again, separate) cafe in the hotel building. This was run by an extremely rude guy in jeans who spoke no English and spent his time counting money. Nobody explained to us what food was included in our 'continental breakfast' voucher, nor where to go or what to do in the restaurant. All that was clear was that all the tasty-looking cooked food was NOT free (but hugely overpriced). So, we took a croissant each, a banana, coffee/tea each, a muffin each, and crisps for later. This was ALL that was on offer. They clearly do not know what a continental breakfast entails! As we were leaving, the rude manager approached us and tried to charge us for EVERYTHING we had taken - even though he wasn't there when we selected it and didn't tell us what was included in our voucher and what wasn't!! After much attempts at communicating with this man, my partner just put back the crisps and muffin, and we left, absolutely furious with the way we had been treated. We tried to bring this up with the front desk, who washed their hands of it, saying the cafe was not run by the hotel - ludicrous answer to give when that is where they send their guests for breakfast!! Aside from the above, our stay was fine. Room was small, and not all that quiet - despite my request for a quiet room. Not because walls were thin but because we were overlooking the street - from reading other reviews I gather a room overlooking a courtyard might have been a possibility. Location was good. There were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room, which I consider an essential, particularly in any hotel claiming to be 2 stars or above. They pretend they provide free coffee/tea, but this was only available in the mornings and only in the foyer - not in the room where you eat 'breakfast'. Customer service-wise, out of the 4 members of staff we encountered, only one was friendly and helpful, a lady with glasses. I reiterate several previous reviews' comments re key cards - hardly work and the help received with these is a joke, particularly as they clearly have issues with them all the time. We certainly would NOT recommend this hotel to anybody seeking a relaxing, enjoyable stay in Boston. Would be fine for anyone there on business who was just in and out for one night.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: katamo22
Reviews.Content: It is a basic hotel, I definitely wouldnÂ´t call it boutique. The furniture was shabby and the room was really small. The fridge was very noisy so it was difficult to sleep. However, it is very centrally located, right next to a metro /commuter rail stop and Copley Square in Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Special!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnandsueLL
Reviews.Content: We'd booked a room, but were given an apartment on the 10th floor [don't know why] and it was superb. Huge living room and bedroom and an equipped kitchen. Everything was spotless. Front of house staff were utterly delightful and accommodating [minor technical problems getting wi-fi apart, but I'm happy to overlook that, it all got sorted]. The hotel is in a terrific position right near Back Bay Station. I don't know how the rooms compare with what we were given, but would recommend the hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Josette99
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room on the 7th floor that was probably larger than the hotel's average room. It was very nice, with a fireplace (not functional of course) which made the room very cozy and warm. The room and bathroom were clean (and cleaned every day). Wi-Fi is included and there is a space to sit with a lap top spot. However, there is no closet to speak of really - hangers behind the door and a tiny space (4 x 2 feet) to hang jackets and pants. But this is a very small inconvenience compared to the overall advantages of the place. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. The building used to be a YWCA and is quite stylish. And the location! You can walk everywhere. There are nice restaurants close by (quite practical when it is pouring rain as it was one night we were there); the Prudential Tower is also within walking distance (great shopping!). I recommend this place and will go back if I visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Back Bay for a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Polishfan
Reviews.Content: Boston is too expensive by half, so we were really pleased with rates at the Hotel 140. It's a smallish hotel in the old YWCA building a half block from the Orange LIne, and about 3 blocks from the Green at Copley (the line for Fenway), perfect for getting around. It's a short walk to either Boylston or Newbury Streets for shopping and restaurants. I'd read that the rooms were small, and ours weren't spacious, but certainly adequate - we didn't spend our time hanging out in the hotel. We wanted comfortable beds (with lots of pillows and good reading lights!), clean bathrooms, and refrigerators to store cold drinks. The decor is simple and modern, the front desk service friendly and helpful, and there's a cafe for breakfast cooked to order (handy on the morning it rained). The only negatives we noticed were that the walls were on the thin side, and some noise bled through. Also, our daughter was called at 10:45 in the evening to be notified that window washers would be working the following day and to keep her windows closed - a bit late for that kind of thing. Overall, though, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: barttrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a vacation to the Boston area. This hotel if very centrally located and close to everything. The rooms are very small (no desk!) but it is in downtown Boston so what can you expect? The walls are very thin (being a former YMCA). Fortunately our neighbors were quiet but I could see that being a problem if you had noisy neighbors. I took the advice of my "Tripadvisor" friends and upgraded to a king size room. They charged me an extra $50 a night (which I didn't think was very cheap) but I did originally get the reservation on a discounted website very inexpensive so overall paid lower than the going rate in downtown Boston. I would also recommend getting the king bed. It was a good size but I wouldn't have wanted to go a lot smaller. The restaurant (not affiliated with hotel) had cheap food but it was also bad food. I would not recommend eating there. The staff in the hotel (especially Jennifer) was very helpful. They sell tickets to local attractions very cheap (especially the Science Museum). so buy your attraction tickets at the front desk. Overall great value for downtown Boston. fitness center none inexistent

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: jeanAustralia
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a result of other trip advisor ratings and were just thrilled! Back Bay is the best location - close to everything. Subway 10 mts from the door. Close to Newbury Street with all the restaurants and shops. Hotel is clean, staff are so friendly, rooms small with excellent double beds, and have everything you need. Exc bathrooms with hair dryers. Good air-conditioning in each room. Free tea/coffee served in reception every morning. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with some wrinkles”
Reviews.Author: ihbToronto
Reviews.Content: This is a basically decent well-priced hotel in a good location. I would give it a higher rating if it weren't for some pretty extreme cluelessness in the customer service department. The hotel is in the Back Bay area of Boston, a very attractive part of Boston with a number of good hotels, restaurants, and shops. It's not tourist central, but it's very close to most of the main tourist attractions either by way of a short subway ride (use Back Bay station just south of the hotel) or though longer but pleasant walks through Boston's downtown neighborhoods. Geographically, it splits the difference between the historical attractions near the waterfront and the two major art museums in the Fenway area -- probably slightly closer to the latter. If your main interest is in colonial history you'll probably want to stay closer to the waterfront. The location is not as prime as some more expensive Back Bay hotels but it's really only steps away from prime Back Bay and it really doesn't matter. We booked (and pre-paid) several nights in a Superior King room. The decor in the King rooms is basic, but the room we had was clean and attractive and light-filled with a good exterior view. There is free wifi but it is somewhat unreliable. There are also old-fashioned ethernet jacks and you may (or may not) get better results if you bring a wired device and an ethernet cable. We had only wireless devices, so I don't know. For reasons that are unclear, they had mistakenly booked us for a standard room with a double bed. They couldn't switch us on the first night, so we experienced the standard room on the first night. The standard room we had was smaller, with an interior view, and (oddly) a dark olive green colour that made it look smaller than it was. Not recommended. The King room is much nicer and not all that more expensive. They switched us to the King room on the morning of our second day. I asked them about a refund of the difference for our first night and they said they would get back to me. They didn't have an answer for me at checkout and I gave them my phone number. They still haven't gotten back to me. It's not a huge sum of money, and I'm not inclined to spend a lot of time chasing it down, but, well, it would have been better had they been proactive about dealing with it. I got the same kind of attitude about the key cards, which are for some reason kind of temperamental. You need a key card to operate the elevator, because it's close to an unlocked exterior door. I noticed a number of people had trouble getting their key cards to work in the elevator, and eventually mine decided not to work at all. The front desk sent me back to the elevator and asked me to try again. I piggybacked on someone else's card, and finally on the next day the front desk gave me a new keycard. They'll eventually solve your problem, maybe, but they won't make it easy... The bottom line is that a superior King room at Hotel 140 is somewhat cheaper than many other recommended hotels in the area, and that gives you a clean, attractive room in a great Boston location. If it weren't for some problems with pretty basic customer service issues, I'd be happy to give it a "very good" rating as far as value for money is concerned. I just wish they'd try a bit harder to make their customers happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: ushakrish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for just two days and really had nothing to complain about.It is very conveniently located and close to the station and Boston Common area around which everything is centered.since it was only my husband and me, the room was adequate and served the purpose.The staff were courteous and if you are looking for a nice place to stay without expecting too much, Hotel 140 is your best bet. All in all ,nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “remarkable find”
Reviews.Author: amandadavies43
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had stayed in the Boston Park Plaza for one night and wanted to extend our stay for another night.We could not be accomodated there so had to find an alternative.We used Expedia using their unnamed option to find a hotel at a reasonable price in the Back Bay area.What a find!! This hotel,which was converted from the YWCA has one of the best locations in the city.It is literally a few minutes walk from Copley Plaza,Back Bay station etc.Our room was smple but comfortable with free local calls and free WiFi.I will advise anyone visiting Boston to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CuseToBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel 140 in Back Bay for 3 nights over the 4th of July weekend and all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor were a big help. It's not for everybody but we will most definately stay here again. The people at the front desk were polite and accomidating as well as friendly. The rooms are very small but if you're going to Boston to spend all day and night in your room then stay home. It was kept very clean and we had everything we needed in the rooms. The AC was great after long days out in the humidity. The location is worth double what we were charged and I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling in to Boston. Parking in the garage right next door is $20/24hrs which is not bad at all. Very easy to get to and out of and EASY walking distance to Boston Gardens, Boston Common, Beacon Hill, Prudential, Newberry St. and some great shopping and food. Also, Copley T stop on the Green line is 1 block away. Simply put, it was exactly what we were looking for! Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished YWCA not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura513
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the two employees at the front desk were unable to tell us the location of our room, they said they were new and did not know the layout. We had alot of luggage because we were traveling to a few locations in a one week time frame so I was requesting a room near the elevator. They had to get their manager away from her lunch break so we could be changed to a room near the elevator. This was unpleasant and time consuming. Once in our room it was small, had no extras (coffee maker). The bed was fine, although the water in the shower did not go down quick enough, so you were standing in your shampoo puddle for a while. The location is good, but I was not impressed by the hotel and considering we paid over $150 a night (hotwire special, lol), I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SarahJT325
Reviews.Content: We were staying one night in Boston before travelling down to the Cape. The location was perfect, easy cab ride in from the airport then back the following morning to pick up a car. It was good to see a bit of Boston and easy to find good places to eat drink and have breakfast. Rooms are small so I would not stay longer than one night here. Facilities limited as we stayed at weekend so no restaurant ( didn't look like we missed alot)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, great staff, a problem quickly solved”
Reviews.Author: Dibry
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the location within walking distance of just about everything - downtown, Fenway Park, Newbury Street, Beacon Hill, shopping, the T line, the hop on hop off bus. And the desk staff are some of the best I've met (especially Nancy) with great advice on everything including where to dine, and making reservations for restaurants and cabs. We would certainly stay there again. The only glitch was when a group of us booked an apartment with two bathrooms in February and arrived to find we had been "upgraded" to a larger space, but with only one bathroom. The staff worked very hard on a sold out weekend to find an additional small room with no charge. The beds were very comfortable. The air conditioners were not all 100% but overall the rooms were comfortable and a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: KrisTravels2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in May 2011. Had a room with a king-size bed, which was quite comfortable. The other furnishings were average, but in good condition. The bathroom was huge, but a lot of wasted space--there was enough space for a large vanity for the single-bowl sink, but it instead had a small vanity tucked into the corner and a small stand next to it to hold toiletries. The room itself was very clean and the hotel was quiet. The staff at the front desk were friendly and very efficient. The location was terrific--only one block from the Back Bay T station. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but is next door to a small sandwich shop; however, the shop wasn't open on Saturday morning when we were looking for breakfast. Fortunately, we didn't have to go far to find somewhere to eat--Hotel 140 is very convenient to Copley Square and Boylston Street. Overall, it was a good deal for the price. I'd definitely consider staying at Hotel 140 again when I'm back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “good value but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: cs2400
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, had a nice staff and is in a great location. Calling itself a "boutique" hotel is a bit of a stretch, though - while the rooms are fine, they are pretty basic. We reserved a Queen room, and they gave us a King bed - which would have been good except that the room was so small that there was only room for one nightstand, because on the other side there was about 8 inches between the bed and the wall. The chair could not be pulled out from the desk because it was right against the other side of the bed. Returning from breakfast at 9:30 am day of checkout, neither room key worked. The friendly young man at the desk apologized, saying, "sometimes that happens on checkout day" - ok, well why don't they fix it and not de-activate the cards until after the 11am checkout time? Also, if you have a car, be aware that there is really no way to pull over in front of the door to drop off your luggage - there are meters in front of one entrance, and a "no stopping" sign in front of the other - you need to park in the garage on the next block and then carry your stuff to the hotel. We spent very little time in the hotel, so it was find for what we used it for.

Reviews.Title: “too much $$ for too little”
Reviews.Author: chuck041
Reviews.Content: great location and clean. But too costly for very small room;and no restaurant on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best Kept Secret; Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie1204
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is pleasant, comfortable, and welcoming. Staff was EXCELLENT. Very clean! AND very affordable!! I will definitely stay here again! Perfect downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Dealy Near Copely Square”
Reviews.Author: mikeg2
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with a quiet room and excellent front desk service.Room and bathroom were spotless.I was able to walk out to great restaurants in the mall around the corner and on Boyleston Street.The Square near the hotel had some beautiful historic buildings and there was a discounted parking lot and train station a few buildings away.The hotel had a good cafeteria weekdays but it was closed weekends. Dunkin Donuts on the street was fine for breakfast Sat.This hotel is an historic site and says YMCA on the sides.Rooms were plainly decorated and bathroom had a standup shower and beautifully folded towels and soaps.Room had a frig,flat screen TV,and internet port ).Hotel is partly run by Hospitality students from BU but also has a professional staff.Hotel fees help subsidize affordable apartments on the top 4 floors and some of the profits support the new YWCA.I would definitely stay here again my next stay.If you need upscale, the Fairmont is around the corner for $400/night.I think I paid $89 on an internet deal for the 140.Lastly it was a great place to walk the city.The Charles River was 4 blocks away and the Commons with its beautiful lake and plantings was a 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value!”
Reviews.Author: Kaaragon
Reviews.Content: I live in the Boston area but stayed here for a night out with girlfriends. The Back Bay location could not be beat, the hotel is right next door to the Back Bay T station and within easy walking distance to both Newbury St. and the South End. The rooms were average size with basic accommodations but were very clean. We had a small problem with our first room and the front desk immediately switched and upgraded our room. Great room and hotel at a really great price.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and Clean Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmtapr
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience during our 3 day stay at the Hotel 140 in Boston. The desk staff was very helpful. Several of them recommended neighborhood eating establishments that were enjoyable and a very good value. The rooms were very clean with a great view of the Hancock building across the street. The location provides good opportunities to take a short walk and visit the Boston Library and Trinity Church. These two historical places are a must see when anyone stays at the Hotel 140. Best thing about staying at this hotel is the value for the dollar. There really was nothing we didn't like about the accommodations. It is not the Ritz but in comes in as a Ten in value Mr and Mrs E. Thompson Visitors from Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 140 is a great Boston downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelhound18
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, the location is A+++ for Boston, easy walking distance to lot's of attractions, restaurants and shopping. The room was not fancy or elegant, more European minimalist style but very clean and nicely decorated, great bed with lots of pillows, huge bathroom. I found the staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Parking garage ($$) is separate but right next door. Subway and busses very close by. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Boston's Center - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: IrishAv8r
Reviews.Content: While visiting friends in the city on Thanksgiving and the festivities went on ... and on (we all know how that goes), I found I was enjoying myself way too much to either want to leave the fun or want to get behind the wheel for the 40 minute drive home to the suburbs. I knew my friends already had guests staying over and I didn't want them to feel obligated to put me up, so my plan was to book somewhere prior to getting to the party. But it in the midst of all the hectic preparations of earlier that day, the reservation just did not happen. So there I sat, late in the evening, in the middle of the party, searching hotels on my iphone and with no success... unless I wanted to pay extortionately high rates at short notice. What's more, all the hotels I was considering were still quite a distance from the city center, where the party was - too far to walk and I would have paid an arm and a leg for a taxi that night. My friends eventually figured out what I was doing and when they learned that I was having no luck finding a place they jumped to recommend Hotel 140, right around the corner, and got on the phone to them for me, right away. They explained to me how great this place was, with excellent location and access, great spacious rooms and low pricing for the city center. Within minutes I was booked and free to enjoy the rest of my night at the party, knowing I could check in at any time of night, whenever I was ready. Also, because my friends often recommended this nearby hotel to friends visiting them in the city, the hotel offered me a stay in one of the available long-term suites. This room was simply amazing. I spend a lot of time traveling for work and am familiar with high end, business class hotels, but I was still taken aback by this place because, to me, it was just like walking into a new, fully furnished apartment and that was so much more welcoming than any hotel room. I had my own fully furnished kitchen area, complete with all utensiles! I really had a wonderful, relaxedd stay there that night and for a fraction of what the other hotels in the area would have charged. I had family in town from Ireland that week and so I met them for a day in the city the next day. In fact, I had them call around to my room that morning and made them breakfast in my room! As I repared to leave, it truly felt weird that I did not have to make my bed or tidy the bathroom - I was so comfortable that it felt like my own apartment all the while and I forgot all about maid service! The reason I am writing this is because, as I walked away from the building that morning I distinctly remember thinking, as I passed the various other high end hotels on my way to pick up my car (all the hotels that were NOT so central as Hotel 140), how good it felt to know I got the best deal - those of us who travel a lot KNOW that is not a feeling you every really get! So now I'm folloing up on a note I took in my iPhone at that time, to write this review. When I got to my car I realized I had left a t-shirt in the hotel and drove by to pick it up. The helpful manager there met me on the curb as I pulled up outside, saving my from having to park illegally - there's good service and then there's the 'delighters' like that! And as I pulled off I realized that no more than 100 yards away there was a tunnel that took me right onto the i-90 west and home - like I said in the title - 'Perfect'! Since my stay, my family liked the place so much as they visited me that they switched to there for the remainder of their visit that time and I've had friends stay there since. I've even been there since, myself, as some roommates and I planned a night in the city and figured we'd share a room and be able to enjoy a fun night in the city with no concerns about planning a ride home that night. something I'll definitely do again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kathy3301
Reviews.Content: booked our room online and wanted a smoking room, when we got here we were told there is a no smoking law in MA but we were allowed to smoke in the last motel so idk...the room is ultra small with a tiny 15 in television rite at the foot of the bed..the fridge barely gets cold so you can't depend on it to keep meds cold...it is clean, I will give them that but unless you want to spend another $50 per night, forget about even a continental breakfast...if you come to Boston on a tight budget but want to splurge for one night don't go to this place

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint of heart”
Reviews.Author: ldstraveler59
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed that I was entering a YMCA. Though simple, the rooms are quaint and clean. The staff friendly. The building is a mixed crowd--an elevator ride could be shared by a vagabond or an aristocrat depending on your luck. And I caution anyone who is looking for hotel with great amenities. All was well with my stay until I returned to the hotel after lunch to find the police in the building with guns drawn and the staff frantic. My safety and that of the area was reassured by the staff, but I was hard-pressed to be at ease. I was glad to be on my way soon thereafter. Had I been alone, I surely would have left. For a moment I thought I was in the Twilight Zone. Great location, but not a place for the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: sprager86
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, well-decorated, downtown. The rooms being a little small is maybe the only downside. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mccarth4
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 is an old converted YWCA building in Boston's South End. Its right next to the John Hancock Tower so you are 1 mile from South Station and in convenient walking distance from the Commons and downtown area, cool bars and restaurants of the South End and shops on Newbury Street in the Back Bay area. The hotel itself may lack some frills but if you're going to see the city and not hang out in your hotel room than it isn't a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “great place!! BAD PARKING!!!”
Reviews.Author: danimx
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay!!! for the price i was expecting something far less than what we got. this was wonderful. the rooms felt homey and we honestly didnt want to leave. we had a corner room, which had a beautiful view from the seventh flooor. a quick one night stay after a bo burnham show, this was all that and then some. another thing, is the toilets are REALLY LOUD! it startled me the first few times and when youre sleeping, you can easily hear them next door. and the heaters in each room are loud aswell but nothing to complain about. but parking.....BAD!! it was terrible. we paid 60 dollars. it is 27 dollars for over two and a half hours. we parked, stayed a while and then wanted to leave for dinner, paid 27, didnt know firsthand! came back and had to pay another 27. bull. we were not happy. there wasnt anything anyone could do which sucked. but all in all we had a lovely stay and i would love to stay agian!!

Reviews.Title: “A great location, wonderful staff, and clean, efficient rooms”
Reviews.Author: timnorling2010
Reviews.Content: Nicely situated between Back Bay and the South End in the former YWCA, this hotel has small but perfectly adequate rooms, is meticulously maintained, and staffed with friendly and accommodating staff. You will not find flat screen t.v.s, dvd players, fully stocked mini bars or luxurious terry cloth towels. You will find an excellent location, up to date accommodations, and a delightful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: fredjones12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great because of the location, friendly staff and clean rooms. It's close to Copley Square, Newbury Street, Downtown and the subway station. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great neighborhood, no luxuries”
Reviews.Author: MonkeybearNYC
Reviews.Content: Great deal, at least in winter. Very friendly and helpful, clean and comfortable. Part of the time I stayed here on my own and felt perfectly safe. Donâ€™t expect luxuries or extras (like a bathtub or a writing desk in the room), but stay for the location and neighborhood: five-minute walk to the best blocks of Back Bay and South End (and around the corner from the Back Bay Amtrak stop). Wifi in lobby and ethernet connection in rooms. Refridgerator in room. Skip the restaurant downstairs in favor of Francescaâ€™s CafÃ© down Clarendon Street to Tremont, or Lâ€™Aroma and Trident bookstore cafe, both on Newberry. Iâ€™d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like staying at the YMCA - you'll love Hotel 140”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler717
Reviews.Content: This is the weirdest hotel in Boston. There's no sign on the outside - but you'll find it by the huge blazing YMCA sign they've left up, a relic of its former owner. The lobby feels like a waiting room for a methadone clinic. There's a public school on the ground floor. There are full time residents who hang on elevators waiting for you to use your house card to ... follow you? There are no locks on the doors to rooms. No coffee makers in the rooms. Internet is a twisted cable you have to plug in to a wall socket behind a dresser. No family or woman could possibly feel safe here. This is a crime scene waiting to happen. Spend twice to stay somewhere else .What an awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel choice for Boston Area.”
Reviews.Author: nyhomesteader
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at Hotel 140. The staff and management are very friendly and accommodating. Very clean and close to public transportation. Exceptional deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, a bit unconventional”
Reviews.Author: CKayE1215
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Hotel 140 due to its great price and proximity to the MFA Boston, which was the prime reason for our trip to Boston. At first the set up of the hotel seemed unconventional, as we have become so used to key cards for hotels and here we got actual keys! But we were upgraded to an apartment room, which had a living room/kitchenette, complete with a full size fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, etc. Although these things were a little superfluous for our 3 day stay, it did have a nice homey feel. The decor was almost there. There was definitely an attempt at a modern, boutique feel, and they almost achieve it, but being in the Design world myself, a little editing was needed. But that being said, the bed provided the most comfortable sleep I have ever had in a hotel, and my husband felt the same way. The location was great for us, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the boutique/historical feel of the place was a refreshing change of pace from the boring commercial printed carpets and bed spreads of most chain mid-level price point hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, not the best service”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, within walking distance to the cityâ€™s parklands and shopping areas. It does feel very dorm-like in itâ€™s layout, considering its history, but it has been modernised and the floor we stayed on had a welcoming feel to it. Another floor I visited felt like a hospital hallway. There were a few hiccups with the front desk staff offering dodgy directions and giving the wrong information a couple of times, which is disappointing. I got better directions and advice from Bostonians on the street, who were all very welcoming and gracious. The actual room was perfect though. It was clean, spacious and looked good. The rate was fairly high at $182USD, but it was one of the better prices in town. I loved Boston and hope to visit again sometime. I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay at this hotel simply due to its location and the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around experience”
Reviews.Author: seajma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took advantage of the Boston City Pass Package Deal which was unbelievable savings. I was skeptical at first thinking the rooms were small and was so pleasantly surprised. Everything, including the cleanliness and stylish room decor was outstanding. I am pretty picky about a clean bathroom and this was bright and imaculate. The front desk staff were knowledgeable and so helpful in guiding us to the perfect Boston places for us to visit during our stay. We look forward to coming back to Boston very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean room in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: JennaRM
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this hotel I was a little worried, but with no need. The room and bed were small but still comfortably fitted my husband and I. It was clean and we had no problems with noise so we were happy. I think it was reasonably good value- most hotels in this good a location are much more expensive. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A smelly tiny room - not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Reuven63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neither a "boutique" nor even a "hotel". The rooms are tiny, the smell was awful, and the fire alarm went off at 1 am. It might have been reasonable at $75 per night, but at $200 per night find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Natimsv
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, close to green and orange T stations. The reception staff is is most friendly and helpful. Room was nice and very clean. I would definitely recommend Hotel 140 to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay right in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: h_rahat
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 is really a gem in the middle of the city. With nearby grocery shops, subway, bus stops and secure place where one won't feel unsecure even late nights on the streets. The hotel is also very suitable if you are staying with little children. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Serious security problem; too bad because rest of stay could have been decent value.”
Reviews.Author: Kay60713
Reviews.Content: Solo women travelers beware -- Three times I returned to my room and found that housekeeping had left the door open (the door was sticking, and they didn't pull it shut). The first two times I reported it right away and was assured it wouldn't happen again.
