After the third time (morning of checkout) I demanded an adjustment to my bill, but they only gave me 10% off - hardly enough if something had happened to my belongings. Also, laundry machines did not work properly, and hot water ruined my clothes even though cold water option was picked. I wish I could give this hotel a better rating, because it could be a decent value if they could get their act together, and the front desk personnel were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Dire - a hostel not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canary10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had mixed reviews on TripAdvisor, but given the extortionate rates for Boston hotels, I took a gamble. And let's remember at $180 a night, I'd say that's still a pretty costly 'gamble'. It's a beautiful building and well located; 2 T stops nearby, excellent restaurants and shops on Newbury St, 5 min walk away. It's a former YWCA and you can tell. I have a feeling that more expensive rooms - the suites - may well have been refurbed. But a normal, standard double, is like a hostel room. Yes, there are signs in the corridor apologizing for the fact that renovation is occuring, but you think they'd at least reflect that in their rates. The room had linoleum floor covering; basic furniture; thin bedding; and a dated bathroom. It was clean in a dated, worn-out way. It was dire for that price.

Reviews.Title: “For a great location and great service, Hotel 140 is the place to stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingon308
Reviews.Content: Htotel 140 is located about a block from Back Bay Station, which was very convenient since we traveled from New York City to Boston on Amtrak's Acela Express. Being near the T station is an important factor when we are deciding where to stay, and Hotel 140 is close to two stations. Our room was spacious and the bathroom was large and well equipped. The reception staff could not have been more helpful. They were very accommodating. We would definitely recommend Hotel 140 in Boston to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best buys in Boston. Clean, Friendly and great location.”
Reviews.Author: jfcone
Reviews.Content: I live on Cape Cod and travel to Boston on business for two days and up to 4. I stay at Hotel 140. for many reasons. Several are the ones above. Plus I can always find street parking. The staff is most friendly and will do anything to make my stay enjoyable. I would recommend it in a minute. Yes the rooms are small but very confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: Tootsie64
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and were very pleased. The room was bi-level being nicely divided into sitting and sleeping areas. Clean, neat and welcoming. The location was perfect. Parking convenient. It was close to the T. Close to Back Bay. Close to great shopping. And the desk clerk sent us to a great neighborhood breakfast place on the other side of the Commons in Beacon Hill. A fantastic walk to a winning venue. We will definitely go back again. You don't pay for amenities or spaces that you won't use. Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjohnson60
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business because of the rate - was not expecting much because I had heard of the hotel and seen the reviews from knowing Boston fairly well. Was very pleasantly surprised - staff was incredibly friendly and helpful - I would liken it to the treatment you receive at Disney. Room was small but nice and very clean - the carpeting was new (they were also installing new carpeting in the hallway on the day of my stay). No breakfast, but I don't know of any central Boston hotel that has breakfast. Parking not the best either - must park in large garage next door. Excellent location however- will return and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting yet trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: DogmomDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with friends afterdisembarking from a cruise..the location is great, walking distance to most everything. Parking is a BIG problem, we had a handcapped placard so street parking was free for us, otherwise it was about 30 a night in a nearby parking structure. Check in was very very slow, we got there at check in and still had to wait way over an hour. Not sure what the issue was, but we were tired and needed to get into our room. The room itself was like an apartment..small kitchen, living area, and one big bedroom and bath..the bedroom had a king bed and a queen bed..good thing we like our friends as we had to share a bedroom with them. Kinda wierd but hey it was ok. I think I would stay there again this time I would be aware of how quirky it is.

Reviews.Title: “Never Have Been So Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: cstoller
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel for 5 nights. First, when we called from the airport and asked for a shuttle we were told they do not provide this service. However, it stated that they did on their website and come to find out, it is stated as such in the room service guide. Most importantly when we arrived at the hotel we found out that our room request for a King room was ignored and we were put in a full size room. Upon entering the room we entered a "dorm" like room where the floor was tiled and my husband had to stand in the corner when you wanted to walk around the bed to the bathroom. The floor was covered with dust balls as well as layers of dust and hair lined the perimeter of the room. The bed also had mystery hairs in the the bed. The top of the shower stall had layers of unknown hair. To top it all off, when my husband stepped out of the shower and attempted to dry off, he was faced with a wad of matted hair and paper in the middle of a "clean' towel. This was the last straw. We packed up and attempted to check out where I was questioned in a rude manner as to why?... I had four more days there. My husband explained what happened and in no way was a refund or even our $27.00 cab fare offered as some way to make it up to us. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Hyatt, plus free net! Don't bother continuing to look.”
Reviews.Author: boyfromhungry
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Hyatt Regency Boston (3-5 Aug 10). Didn't love it: too many large groups, bad concierge service, boring ultra-touristy area, $10/day internet charge. Found Hotel 140 on Priceline and decided to give it a go. Best. Decision. Ever. Hotel 140 had an excellent location just off Copley Square and Boston Public Library, quick walk to the T, bustling cafÃ©/shopping area on Newbury Street . Front desk service was friendly, accurate, knowledgeable, efficient. Room was immaculate and well kept, TV, small wardrobe, lots of light and cushions. Bed was great, made everyday, great linens. Plenty of towels, toiletries and cups. And a single dataport with ethernet cable. Building also had cafÃ©, although I didn't try it. Did use the great laundry room upstairs. Again, immaculate, well kept and front desk was very helpful (i.e. had plenty of quarters every day). Will not be looking elsewhere next time I go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: vienna_myCapital
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because its web site stated: "a boutique hotel in the heart of Boston at an affordable price" and the pictures seemed to confirm that! Well... FORGET IT! The only good thing about the 140 Hotel is its location (next to a subway station, not far away from Boston downtown). For the rest, it is a huge anonimous building with a big, cheesy lobby and very little friendly staff! We were at the 8th floor and it all looked like a low-level student dorm. Our bedroom was ridicolous: tiny small (we didnt even have a double bed, but a large single bed!!), with third-class furniture, a quite noisy fridge and a dirty rug! The only "amenities" were an old microwave and a decent and clean (although very small) bathroom! No breakfast, no wi-fi, nothing, at a crazily high price!!! I wonder who the heck gave 3 stars to this place! So, our personal advice, if you want to visit Boston, is to pick some other hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Reefcrazy
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from TripAdvisor reviews and we are glad we did it. First of all: location. Around the corner from a T station an, a few blocks from great shopping places like Newbury St. and the Prudential Center. Also, a very safe neighborhood. The hotel has free wi-fi in the lobby and a free computer for guests use as well. Nicely renovated room with a fridge for guests use. I'd add a coffee maker to make it perfect. We got a great rate through AAA.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: michelenancy
Reviews.Content: Don't let the entrance fool you. As you're really stayin in college dormitories. Insanely small and aquardly shaped rooms, cheapy particle board furniture, linolium floors throughout, no TV channel rentals, no continental breakfeast, no room service, not even an ice or water machine. The staff never knew how to answer my questions about the most basic hotel information, and when it came to parking in they're garage, forget it. 27$ for 24 hrs and that's only if you get it validated, but then you can't come and go. You're car better just stay put. The sheets were soft though? Bed was tiny. Great location! For the money, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wilkerson037
Reviews.Content: excellent price real nice place to stay helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for the value you get (an updated YMCA)”
Reviews.Author: agranja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located but this is its only positive point. A couple of years ago, this hotel has been a YMCA. The only difference between now and then is a refurbishment. Seems like they took a lot of effort into the entrance lobby because the rooms are still on YMCA standard (except the bathrooms which are functional but very small). The main downside is the price -it's way too high for the value you get. We've paid 150 $ four 1 night which is definitely too much if you take into account the fact that you actually sleep in an slightly updated YMCA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: GinaTooch
Reviews.Content: Usually when you get a great deal on a hotel in a major city, you have to lower your expectations. However, that is not the case with Hotel 140! The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean and we could not have asked for a better location. I highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR!”
Reviews.Author: Ostento
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 140 in April, 2010 with a friend. The staff was incredibly helpful, the room was very clean, the shower was nice. Everything was perfect, could not have had a better time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small, friendly hotel in the theater district of Boston. Conveniently located, easy to get all around the city. The subway is just around the corner, Wilbur theater is a short walk away. Could not have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Will E
Reviews.Content: Great location, reasonable price - but expect paper thin walls so you can hear ALL your neighbours bathroom activity!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan Rooms Are Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: No_Names_Are_Leftt
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location. Staff was friendly. Cons: Rooms were very spartan. Furniture was obviously discount bin stuff. TV was surprisingly small (19-inch, I believe). Bathroom was bizaarely huge given how small the actual living area was. You could literally fit another bed in the bathroom. I think most would say "shrink the bathroom and expand the living area." The only tabletop in the room was a tiny bedside table (no desk or other surface). The bed was OK, though the bedding (pillowcases, blanket, etc) did appear a little long-in-the-tooth. No free continental breakfast. No wi-fi. There is a balled up network cable you can stretch to your bed to plug into your laptop though. Since this building used to be a YWCA (we assume judging by the signs outside) the room has a strange anomaly: unlike most hotels which have classy ambiguous paintings, the Hotel 140 rooms were decked out with large, real, poster photos of a family celebrating someone's birthday and another of girls exercising. You have to see it yourself to understand how UTTERLY these things do not belong in a hotel room, but to quote my girlfriend: "What the ****?' Lastly, despite there being a Do Not Disturb sign on our doorknob, a staff member knocked twice and then came in one morning! I looked at her from the bed and she scurried back out. This was not cleaning staff, this was a front-desk lady. I didn't complain because I'm a nice guy, but come on, "Do Not Disturb" means DO NOT DISTURB. The price was too much given the spartan nature of the rooms and the lack of free breakfast. If you need a hotel in the Back Bay area and don't mind motel-quality at hotel-rates, this is for you, otherwise I recommend you find a similarly priced alternate in another part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a great Price”
Reviews.Author: Nicki73262
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and parents from Germany for the 4th of July night. It was withing perfect location to the great dining options of the South End (for those new to the city, head south/away from from center on Claredon Street and you will hit it) and within a short walk to the Esplanade. We didn't look for a fancy place to stay just something convenient and clean. Parking was available across the street from the hotel for $27 a day. You can't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “City Break Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: DrEsther
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews of this hotel complain about the size of the rooms and the stark nature of the decor, but to be honest you can't complain given the price you pay for the location. The rooms are small by US standards, but the bedding and bathroom were clean, nice toiletries and staff were really helpful. The complimentary breakfast has now gone, but there are plenty of local cafes to meet such a need. If you're in visiting Boston for a few days and don't intend spending much time in your room it's perfect - and the profits are going to a good cause (YWCA).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel in a great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: vk1976
Reviews.Content: We spent a Memorial Day Weekend in Boston. 140 Hotel represents an affordable option, in a great location. For 139$ a night, we got a spacious room on 14th floor that was furnished in an old style. The windows faced a quiet street. We were nicely surprised to discover that there was a fully complete kitchenette too, that included a stove, a microwave, and a refrigerator! Another surprise was to discover a theater on the second floor of the building. We took advantage of it and saw a great play "Blithe Spirit" (by N Coward) there. The downsides included not the greatest cleanliness, a small bathroom (where the sink was close to get obstructed), and poor breakfast. I would advice NOT to get breakfast there but to reserve a room alone. Overall, the experience was a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Still more like a Y than a regular hotel”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler93
Reviews.Content: While the location can't be beat be wary of this hotel. I was given an upgrade to a suite (usually makes me very happy) but while the space was terrific--large sitting room/kitchen and large bedroom, it lacked many features that make a room comfortable. The lighting was sub-par--the large sitting room had only one floor lamp--no lamp on the desk, or any overhead lights to dispel the gloom. The same for the bedroom which admittedly did have 2 lamps but the only table lamp was not anywhere near the bed. Instead of a nightstand there was an orange vinyl kitchen chair to perch your glass of water, book or whatever. Don't expect to be able to read in bed here. Ladies better understand that the only mirror was the small one over the sink. As a matter of fact there was nothing on any of the walls except a forlorn wall clock--no art, mirrors or anything in way of decor. The bathroom was very small but functional (it was the passageway between the sitting room and bedroom) except for the suprising omission of a hook or rack to place your wet towels. This became more of an issue as i was suprised to learn --on my second day at the hotel--that these suites are not given regular housekeeping service. The bed was fine and the room very quiet but the lack of curtains or drapes--only wooden blinds which let in a considerable amount of morning sunlight-might disturb a light sleeper. If you are paying rock-bottom prices the place will serve well, but as I was paying more than $200 per night I expected something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Goldfinch2324
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's small, but how much time do you spend in a hotel room when you're in a city as exciting as Boston? Those who complain about the size must live in their rooms! My wife and I were very pleased. It was clean (I've stayed at some 5-star places that were filthy!) and the people at the front desk were very helpful -- from early baggage storage to helping us navigate Boston via the subways. You couldn't ask for a better location. It is central to all that is happening in Boston. I would recommend it highly! Besides, it was an easy walk to Fenway!

Reviews.Title: “Best find of the year!!”
Reviews.Author: OHG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best value for dollar you will find in any big city. Great location. Comfortable rooms. Friendly & helpful staff. All for a price anyone can afford. We travel a lot, and this is my best find yet.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a deal”
Reviews.Author: bmariner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of downtown Boston and quite a deal. We paid $71/night with AAA discount. The room was recently redone. Very clean , private bath, I'net access in room. No disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 140 is quaint and cozy with a pleasant and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelNY2010
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 140 in Boston, MA, is a historical and charming building. The architecture of the lobby is beautiful and the rooms are spacious, warm and clean (with extremely cozy beds). The staff was exceptionally courteous and helpful with directions to points of interest and local restaurants. The building is located in Copley Square, which is a historical area in Boston and full of things to do and places to go. My family and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay somewhere that is comfortable and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Above average service and room for the price”
Reviews.Author: abonyang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here (we're in our early 30s) from a Friday to Tuesday and found the accommodations to be above average for the price (with tax we paid about $110.00 a night). We kept our "do not disturb" sign up the entire time so we can't attest to the day to day housekeeping, however, our room was clean and tidy upon arrival and the staff left a bag with fresh towels and shampoo/conditioner/lotion/soap in front of our door daily. This extra effort meant a lot to us. The front desk also provided us with a razor and toothpaste as we neglected to bring our own. Matt checked us in and out and was friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. Our room had a fridge. Located within two minute walk of the Back Bay T stop and walking distance to Shaw's (a small supermarket) and a mall. Wendy's, Burger King, a BBQ/steak house called Whiskey's, California Pizza Kitchen, PF Chang's, all within 10-15 minute walk. A wired connection to the Internet (long cord too!) was in the room free of charge. A microwave would have been a nice addition to the room. Also the gym was just an elliptical machine, a recumbent bike and a balance ball shared by all guests. However, we only had to wait 10 minutes to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!! The worst most unfriendly hotel in boston!!!!!!! Dont even waste your time”
Reviews.Author: MCofran
Reviews.Content: They are truly the worst people to stay with. I was completely upset with my stay. The hotel over charged me, told me that I could not have another room, even though not all my guests could not stay in the room. The room only had a twin and full size bed, and I had four people with us. We called and they did nothing. They treated me horribly and did not even care. I just want to let everyone know that it is the worst that I have every been treated. They just want your money and dont care about you or your guest, Stay elsewhere and save yourself the pain and frustration.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: llivrob
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to celebrate my birthday and had booked the Happy Birthday package online. When we got to the hotel we could not have been happier with the location. It was so close to all of the historical sites so that we could walk to everything. There was also a subway only a block away for when the weather cooled too much for these Californians so we didn't want to walk. Now the room was pretty simplistic, but for the price and the location it was worth it. We didn't plan on staying in the room a lot. We did have problems with getting room keys that would work (something to do with a new lock being installed from a different floor) and it took 5 times and a day before we actually had keys that worked, but the staff could not have been more helpful and let us into our room several times. We highly recommend the hotel and will stay there again. One note: if you book an online package make sure you have proof and follow up with the manager during the stay. I had discounted room rate that was not honored during the stay but after several e-mails the manager did refund us and personally called me.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: paman2000
Reviews.Content: So I booked this trip on Priceline because I was coming to a conference and quite honestly didn't need anything that great for me to crash a couple of nights. At first look, I did get a bit lost, signage isn't the best thing w/ the hotel, but once I got inside the gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. I needed a package to be delivered and before I was officially checked in, he made sure that I had received it. Based on some of the reviews I was expecting a bare bones kind of room, and that is just about what you get. My room simply had a bed, desk, office chair, and wardrobe. The linoleum floors were interesting. However bare bones this room was, it was very clean. I was hoping for a bathtub, but the stand up shower was fine. Overall, not that bad for the location and the price. Don't have high expectations. But I would still recommend this place for a cheap, clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very frendly staff and clean and close”
Reviews.Author: railfanMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from oct 28th through november 2nd. the staff that waited on me were friendly and helpfull. not once did they complain or anything. they were helpful with my questions and my late arrival. when i had problems with the door key card they were very helpful. When i accidentally checked out early due to me being confused on the time(the alarm clock i had with me is very easy to mess up the time when setting the alarm and when it read 10:40PM i thought it was really 10:40AM and i was panicking thinking i was going to miss my train back to Chicago.) they were very helpful and re-instated my reservation. When i had more problems with the door key(i went up and down in the elevator at least 5 times trying to get the card to work) they did not complain or anything. they ended up putting me in a different room(this was after i checked out by accident) for the rest of the stay. i would highly recommend this place. i did not try the cafe so cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Um...Is this the right place”
Reviews.Author: BostonOnBusiness
Reviews.Content: Okay...as a frequent traveler to Boston, I tend to stay at the ParkerHouse- Omni but the 140 was $50 a night cheaper so I made the switch. House staff was not particularly friendly or welcoming. The rooms were small and set up like a dorm room Bed was comfortable but it was like I had yet to move all my stuff in on college move in day.- Nice old YWCA pictures on the walls. I was in the elevator with folks with large bags of recycling who where quite nice who were also staying at the hotel. Linens in bath were stained. NO secondary security lock from the inside of the room!! Generally would not recommend to anyone who was on business but perhaps if you are just looking for a place to drop after a hard day of vacationing...even then think about the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: dthomp2701
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in October. I would recommend it for someone wanting a decent priced hotel (for Boston) and a good location. It is a couple blocks from Newbury Street (lots of restaurants and shops), the Freedom Trail, and the Public Gardens and Common. Make sure you verify reservations because they lost ours for the first stay but recovered the mistake by upgrading us to a suite. The rooms are very contemporary (and in my opinion not very comfortable for lounging in the room) but the furnishings are nice and the service is good. There is no continental breakfast but they give you a coupon for two items (coffee, juice, pastry) at the little cafe off the lobby. Also no coffee in the room. WiFi is good and free paper in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and bathrooms are very small!”
Reviews.Author: TacomaLv2travel
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the hotel 140 were very small. In the bathroom you couldn't open the shower door and the bathroom door at the same time. The closet was waist high. Some of the floors did not have carpeting in the rooms or hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: IowaIndigoGirl
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the mixed reviews about Hotel 140 on this site, I didnâ€™t know what to expect when we checked in on Monday, Oct. 5 for a five-night stay. Our party included me, my husband, and my husbandâ€™s two sons (ages 18 and 20). The room we had reserved for the two boys wasnâ€™t available, so they upgraded them to a suite (room 1010) at the same price as the room! They each had their own bedroom and bathroom and shared a living room/kitchen area. My husband and I stayed in a room with one queen sized bed (room 712). I really loved the dÃ©cor. It was minimalistâ€¦no ugly paintings of bright flowers on the walls! Our room was small, but very clean and well maintained and quiet, as was the suite. Our only complaints were that the shower in my husbandâ€™s and my room gave new meaning to low flow. We are used to high water pressure, and this shower was pathetic, but we managed. The A/C unit in our room was also quite loud, but, again, we managed. Those are truly the only two negatives. There are many positives of Hotel 140, most notably its excellent location. Itâ€™s only a half block from the Back Bay T station and within a short walking distance to a grocery store, several restaurants and businesses, and parks. We walked everywhere or took the Tâ€”no need whatsoever for a car unless you plan to travel outside of the city. It is also very close to the airport. Both rooms had fridges, so we ate breakfast in our rooms most of the time. The hotel has a small cafÃ© attached to it where one can get breakfast, lunch, beverages, and snacks. The boys did use the vouchers for breakfast a couple times, and also bought breakfast in the cafÃ© a couple times. I think one paid only $5 for an omelet, bacon, and potatoes. Overall, Hotel 140 offers outstanding value for the money. We enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I was TURNED AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: katiemankin
Reviews.Content: If there was a "zero" rating, I wouldn't even pick that. I'd still give this hotel a negative rating. I was traveling for my first time ever in Boston for work just a couple of nights ago. I got a great deal on this hotel and was really excited to stay in someplace "local" and not another chain hotel. I told my entire family and friends about how great the hotel looked and how much I was looking forward to staying here. Well, upon walking into the hotel at about 3:15p (15 minutes after check-in started) the woman at the front desk was unable to find my reservation. She looked everywhere. So, she asked who I assumed must have been the manager and he said, "Oh, yeah, I'll handle it." He grabbed an envelope, handed it to me, and said, "Sorry, we have a big conference in town and we overbooked. All the details you need are in this letter.' THEN - he proceeded to look at the guest behind me in line and say, "May I help you?" The stupid letter just said, "Due to circumstances beyond our control, we are unable to accomodate you. We have booked a room for you at the John Hancock Hotel next door. Thank you." The guy at the front desk gave me no help, no choice, nothing. I went to the John Hancock hotel - which was like a prison, and which merits another review not to be explained here - and just about cried because I was basically stranded in a city I had never been to before with NO help from this awful, awful hotel. The insult to injury was that I parked in the parking garage for $27 and Hotel 140 would NOT reimburse me for parking in there even though they gave my room away. I travel a lot for work and I can honestly say that this has been the WORST experience at a hotel in my entire life. Beware if you're looking to stay here. The service is terrible, terrible, TERRIBLE! And you may not even get what you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gracie24
Reviews.Content: 7 thirty-something friends stayed at the Hotel 140 for 5 nights in September 2009. 3 of us stayed in the "Adams Room" for the first night and then all 7 of us stayed in the "Kennedy Suite" for the remaining 4 nights. The Adams Suite contains 2 double beds while the Kennedy Suite contains 1 King Size Bed, and 4 double beds. We had no idea what to expect from either room but was pleasantly surprised with both. The "Adams Room" was on the small side, but we were told to expect this with all Boston hotel rooms. The Kennedy Suite contained a sitting room, a king bedroom, a large room with 4 double beds, 3 TVs, several bureaus and dressers, small fridge, microwave, and ONE bathroom. My only complaint would be the sole bathroom, but we knew this going in, and made our bathroom schedule accordingly. We found the building itself to be easy to find. The rooms were clean, tastefully decorated, and relatively modern. The shower stalls were a bit on the small side but the bathroom itself was a good size. As other posters have noted, the location of this hotel is incredible. Easy walking to the Subway lines, downtown restaurants, parks, shopping, etc. We found most of the staff to be very pleasant and accomodating. We ran into a snag with transportation and the Consierge did her absolute best to help us out. The restaurants and local attractions that were recommended were also top-notch. We found ice machines and vending machines on all floors. There is also a business centre on the 6th floor with a computer/printer for guest use. The "complimentary breakfast" did consist of 1 muffin and 1 coffee, but we felt that the price of the room more than made up for this shortcoming. As mentioned, the hotel doesn't have a restaurant or bar. The Stuart Street Grill is located at the back of the hotel and serves a very reasonably priced breakfast and lunch. In all, I think this hotel is a great value compared to the other hotels in the same area (Fairmont, Lennox, Colonnade, etc.) You don't get all the fancy stuff, but the rooms are comfortable clean and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms like an hostel, the price for an hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lucrezia09
Reviews.Content: The photos of the rooms the "hotel" shows are not the rooms you get! at least the room on the 8th floor that we got!! not one beside table not bedside lamp! the bedspread stained with coffe or tea! The "continental breakfast" included was actually 1muffin and 1drink! I was very embarrassed with my partner because it was me that booked that room! It was supposed to be a 3stars hotel instead of an hostel, according to the picture and the price! Good location and free internet access. Staff ok.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Hotel 140 was the "icing on the cake!"”
Reviews.Author: moysha915
Reviews.Content: WOW what a location! Coming from NY we expect alot and Hotel 140 met our expectations. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated, comfortable and the package we had was great! The staff was pleasant, professional and accomodating. Having a theatre attached to the hotel was perfect or us as we are a family with a teenager who loves the theatre. Also having a "light fare", reasonably priced place to eat right there in the hotel was so convenient especially in the morning. The parking garage right next door along with the train and bus depot makes this a very convenient place to stay. The shopping just 2 blocks away, an Equinox Fitness Center, and wonderful area eateries makes Hotel 140 a place where you can have a long term stay if need be. We would definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Good position, decently priced but the room was a joke”
Reviews.Author: randagioItaliano
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest of this hotel the 10th and 11th of Augut 2009. The positives are: Great postion less than 10 minutes walk from Boston common and the Theatre district, 1 minute walk from the Back Bay underground station. Nice historical building with character. Very reasonable rates. Very friendly staff. The negatives are: The room is much smaller than the standard. The water mixer of the shower didn't work properly and the staff wasn't available to fix it. You couldn't turn off the aircon otherwise it would bcome noisy. The breakfast sucks badly (one muffin plus a louisy coffee). Saty here only if you get a good deals and nce you get in the room check everythibng is working properly if not ask immediately to change the room (I should have done that!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Hotel Very Lacking”
Reviews.Author: MaudeNortheastUSA
Reviews.Content: This "Boutique Hotel" (which resembles a youth hostel) is actually 40 rooms carved out of the YWCA. Other mysterious residents are living on various floors. Poor signage, as you think you are entering the Y...no doorman...no pull-up area for unloading the car. A public garage is down the street (which costs $59.00 for 1 1/2 days with no hotel validation) You cannot check in until 3:00 pm, so baggage must be stored. The woman who greeted us was welcoming; the other staff pleasant but not too knowledgable.We found 140 to be clean, but smelling of sour mop and lacking in almost all hotel ammenities. No restaurant, bar, ice machine or even drink machine. We had to walk to CVS for bottled water. Our floor and room had only bare linoleum, like a classroom. Room did not lock from the inside. Postage stamp-size room with Ikea-style double bed, headboard, 2 chairs, tiny desk (with TV taking up most of it), and a stand-alone wardrobe. That's it! No rack for suitcase. No place to put anything in the bathroom, with the tiniest shower stall imaginable, and neither of us is fat. Bring your own shower cap. "Continental breakfast" from Dunkin' Donuts consisted of 2 boxes of coffee (which were empty) and a few donut holes. Fortunately, you can walk to Dunkin' Donuts to buy your own coffee. Good location, and convenient to several of the best restaurants in Boston, but one night was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location...”
Reviews.Author: fairey_queen
Reviews.Content: Good location, right near the trendy back bay area and few blocks from the start of the freedom trail & posh shopping mall (provincal center). Also right near a t station. Room was small but had everything that you need, air con, flat screen tv & comfy bed. Coridoors a bit univiting and had a suspicous smell of bleach. Obviously some of the rooms are let for emergency social housing and we ran ino a few of the 'long' term residence in the lift, they were friendly enough but may be a bit scary for a lone traveller esp if you are not expecting it. Breakfast was also a bit disapointing and not explained very well. Voucher was given for the coffee shop onsite, though no one explained that it was for a free coffee and muffin, huge selction of other food avalible but cost extra. Overall think you are paying for the location really & not the hotel, wont be rushing back!

Reviews.Title: “Well Priced Hotel in an Historic Building with Downtown Boston Just Steps Away”
Reviews.Author: skg5
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was perfect. The hotel is superbly located just steps from Copley Square. Back Bay and the sights of downtown Boston. Also conveniently nearby are shopping, parking and transportation. The hotel is in an historic building with modern rooms and tiled baths, all spotless. The hotel staff is professional and super friendly. And last, but certainly not least, I found the charge for my room extremely reasonable. I recommend that you look into staying here when you visit Boston. Susan Griffing, 241 Eddy Road, Eagle Bridge, NY 12057

Reviews.Title: “Mixed...some great parts, some not so great”
Reviews.Author: luckysmomnyc
Reviews.Content: Plus: Terrific location at Copley Square, near train stations. Great price on a last minute booking. Clean. Helpful staff. Nice lobby. Minus: Tiny, spartan room. Institutional-feeling hallway. Small bed (but pretty comfortable). Few amenities. Continental breakfast was very limited. Would probably be an okay situation for someone travelling alone who mainly needed safety and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, thats true”
Reviews.Author: FamilyIreland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 nts stay with my husband & our two teenage girls. I had made the booking on their website months earlier, but when we arrived there was some confusion over the booking. Even though they could clearly see there were 4 of us in the group and that was the amount the booking was made for, we were sent to a room with two single beds. After waiting for some considerable time, (about an hour) during which time another couple were having problems with their booking, we were given another room with 2 single beds. Whilst this was very awkward, as we were sharing suitcases, we accepted the rooms and having travelled from Ireland we were very tired. The floor we were located on was very similar to a hostel and was extremely basic. The next day however we were moved to the 'suite', and we stayed here for the following 2 nts. It was nice, very comfortable. The breakfast was coffee or tea and a muffin or croissant, which was ok for a complimentary breakfast. If we had of remained in a room similar to our first room I would have considered this hotel to be very overpriced, obviously since it was the hotels mistake we got the suite for the same price but beware as the booking and reception staff lacked professionalism. Just as an add on comment, i have a major problem when holidaying in USA regarding being given paper or plastic cups, plates and utensils, i can't stand this practice, the breakfast in Hotel 140 is no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet!! Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: dorothyeros
Reviews.Content: Woud stay here again anytime! Right in the middle of all the Boston attractions! Clean, quiet and helpful, friendly staff! Thanks Hotel 140!

Reviews.Title: “could not sleep in the morning.”
Reviews.Author: jmvoyagerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights (Sat + Sun.). The first morning, we were waken up by construction in the street. We were on the 6th floor but could hear the workers as if they were next to our window. We even checked to make sure all the windows were closed. Also, the curtains were shear and we had the sun in our face and couldn`t go back to sleep. We asked to change room which we did. The hotel staff was pretty clueless, no appologies just blank stare, as if they had never heard of this before. We did get a new room that had real curtains and was away from the noise. Overall, the rooms are poorly designed. It is ok for two days but I would get annoyed if I had to stay longer. There are no tables and no counter in the bathroom. You have to put everything on the floor. The shower head faces the door so if you start the water it goes on the floor. Even 2 star hotels in Europe don`t make that mistake. They told us breakfast was served until noon on weekends, there is even a sign in the front of the hotel but on Sunday, we went at 11:40 and it was closed. We knocked and a women gave us muffins but there was no coffee. It seemed like everything was a chore, even getting our voucher for the breakfast. Also note that there is a taxe from the state that they didn`t put on their website. So for a room of 110$/night, their is a 13$ a night charge. If you go for only two nights and the price is less than 100, I guess it is ok but I won`t be going back there. Location isn`t everything, especially in a city that has a subway and that is easy to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Social Assistance Living in one”
Reviews.Author: theroyalg
Reviews.Content: This hotel, for those of you who aren't aware...rents rooms but also provides a place of residence for those collecting social assistance..so if you're in the elevator with a shady looking individual..that's not someone who has snuck into the hotel..they are likely staying on the same floor as you are... Without concluding my thoughts on our stay here..i'll let you decide

Reviews.Title: “great service!!!”
Reviews.Author: thomasnana
Reviews.Content: we booked our room for 4 people on very short notice & were a little nervous about what we were going to get due to the low price. what a nice suprise when we walked into a lovely lobby & greeted by a friendly desk staff. when we got to our room it was very large & very clean! the bathroom was stocked with plenty of towels for all of us. to top all that we were in the heart of boston & could walk to all of the sites we wanted!! we are already planning on taking in a ballgame at fenway & will book with hotel 140 again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for theatre and restaurants and very clean, comfortable and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: BPS9
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay there--very easy to get to the theatre and restaurants by walking. Although there is no parking at the hotel, there is a garage next door. The room was very clean and quiet. And the hotel staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: kstephenk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 140 and enjoyed our rooms. Beds were comfortable, pillows were great, and the location unbeatable. Not all the rooms were equal .. we had several rooms, and some were small and some were larger. All were clean. Parking is extra and in the nearby Public Parking garage. A drop-off zone would have been welcome. Guests have use of a computer with internet and printing, which was nice. Free continental breakfast was OK, but limited not much. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Staff Plesent, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GoSawks247
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 was great for a short stay. The staff was very plesent and helpful with directions. Excluding the shower, the room we stayed in was great. My only minor complaints about this hotel was the shower and the design of the hotel. The shower head is pointed towards the bathroom door and when I finally got the shower to work It sprayed water into my room.(Shower dial says to turn right for water, However, you actually need to turn it left) Also, the hotel divide's the elevators between guest such as myself(tourist) and business clients which I did not appreciate it. All in all, I was very satisfied with my stay hotel and would certainly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great for a short stay, in a great location, staff was great”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: Hotel 140 is a great purchase if you get it at the right price. Its in an awesome location on Clarendon St. The subway stops are a short walk from the hotel. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with all questions I had. Overall, the room was nice, but the bathrooms were small. The shower was extremly small and when you turn on the shower in sprayed into the bathroom, so beware of that. I would feel bad for a heavier person to try to shower in the showers, but for me it was fine. Parking wasn't as bad as other hotels in Boston $27 for the night. Make sure you get your parking stub validated by the hotel otherwise you'll pay over $50 for the night. The continental breakfast wasn't bad. You have the option of a bottle of juice, water, or soda as well as a muffin or croissant. Thats all I need in the morning. I was very satisfied for the price I paid, and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, nicely decorated but small rooms, and everything you need. Great value. However, there is virtually no soundproofing between rooms or between the room and the hallways. Any conversation seems to reverberate from room to room. Also, at night, the light from the hallway shone into my room. Bottom line: great room, but a bad night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanjoseBayArea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. For the money, the location and service can not be beat. The rooms and restrooms are small, but that is what I expected from the reviews. I would stay here again in the future. This is the best value in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Of 11 different hotels in Boston, I will return to this one.”
Reviews.Author: Nessie22
Reviews.Content: Yes--we've graduated! Over the past 5 years, I've stayed in 11 Boston area hotels, for college-related activities and moving daughter in/out of Northeastern Univ and surroundings. This is the first one that I can say I will return to (now that she has decided to work and settle in Boston.) This hotel is great if you plan to walk or use the T. If you need a car to get around/transport child and belongings for multiple trips to Bed/Bath/Beyond, etc., then check out the Days Inn Soldier Field or Ramada in Cambridge for the easy access and free parking. (Good luck with the driving in Boston...) If you are looking for a central location with very easy access to the T (2 stops within 3 blocks), and in easy walking range to Boston Commons, shopping, and restaurants, this is a great place to stay. The rooms are simply furnished, but modern with comfortable bed, towels, shower, and any amenity you might want, just no frou-frou or fancy tdecor. Continental breakfast on-site was a nice extra--easy to grab coffee and croissant on your way out the door. Front Desk allowed early check-in and stored my luggage after checkout for a late day flight.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: greenhbrfan
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The lobby is charming and clean. The hallways are bright and colorful (not dark and dingy like I just read in a previous review). We stayed in the Wellesley room and thought it was perfect for our purpose. This is a boutique hotel, not the ritz. I'm giving the room a 4 because the mattress does need to be replaced, but still comfortable enough to sleep on. The bathroom and room was spotless. I knew that the room and bathroom were small, and we were fine with that. The cafe downstairs was available for breakfast. We got the complimentary coffee and muffin. Would we go back? In a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Almost like the Y...”
Reviews.Author: chinsb
Reviews.Content: I won in a fundraising raffle a night at this "boutique hotel" and tkts to the Lyric Stage, which is located on the mezzanine level of this hotel. While the thought that they converted the original YWCA to a "boutique hotel" in the Back Bay was charming, the reality was disappointing. The facade and lobby of the Y wasn't changed much, which was OK, but the "Wellesley Suite" we had was tiny. In fact it was a small BR with a tiny sitting area (about 4x4') and a small bathroom that has no tub. The old fireplace was still there, but oddly empty, and the TV was maybe 19" max. Worst was the lumpy bed, which should have been replaced a few years ago. While the room was very clean, the hallways were creepy, dank, and stuffy. The "breakfast" that was included consisted of 1 muffin and a cup of coffee - limit 2 items! While this is a very good value for the budget minded for the Back Bay, the comfort level of the room and hotel was below par, less than what you'd get in a chain like Hampton Inn, or even Days Inn. Even the front desk was staffed with personnel who couldn't quite handle the reservation or the paperwork - maybe we'll get a bill for the room that was complimentary...

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: royBoston
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, to the second we left, service, service service, Lets not forget the value, and it was clean,rooms simple and nicely done In all honesty we were not sure what to expect based on the price point of the accommodations but,we were pleasantly surprised, Location was great, no doorman, but who cares, I would highly recommend Hotel 140 , and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: hartley1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been characterized as a "budget boutique" hotel and that is a great desciption. My husband and I found it very charming with little touches we weren't expecting (nice shampoos for ex.). We had a Wellesley Suite which was more than adequate for our needs. It had a refrigerator and carpeting, which I guess some of the less expensive rooms don't have, as well as a queen size bed. The room also had a cooling system, but at times the AC seemed a bit underpowered, but we were generally able to cool off. The location was excellent - we wereable to walk to our conference on Commonwealth Ave, to Beacon Hill, and to restaurants on Tremont Street as well as to the Prudential Center and Copley. There is a parking garage a block from the hotel - we left our car in there for the 3 days we were in town. We saved hundreds of dollars staying here over the very pricey hotels in the area like the Eliot, Park Plaza, etc. If you are looking for a real luxurious place, then look at those places, but if you want a nice, clean, superbly located hotel that will leave you money to spend in Boston, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, clean, great price and location”
Reviews.Author: bostro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 140 during the Boston Marathon and for a few days after. Although there was a madhouse going on due to the huge number of visitors to the area, the staff was patient, wam and very competent. The hotel itself is fairly spartan (former YWCA) but was clean and still had a lot of charm. The location is fantastic...right in Copley Sqaure and within walking distance of many of the great sites in Boston and 2 subway lines. The price was great as well so we recommend this place highly for those looking for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: megerhardt
Reviews.Content: What a find! This small hotel is clean, in a great location, and is run by friendly, capable people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker1327
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel 140 for one night and found it to be comfortable, clean, good value for money and in a very good location. We would stay there again if we went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lildigs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 140 for 3 nights and highly recommend this to anyone who is looking to visit Boston. The hotel is in the middle of the city - right by tons of restaurants and shops and near the T so it's easy to get anywhere you want to go. The hotel staff is very nice, and the room is cozy and clean. This is a great place for a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: addyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend a couple weeks ago when I was in town for a weekend and was really happy I found this place. The staff was friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable and all for a great price! It is located near tons of great restaurants, shopping, nightlife, and close to public transportation to get around the rest of the city. I really enjoyed my stay here and will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: vangogh13
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, central location and a great price. Steps to Copley Place, Newbury Street and the South End. Staff was very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, great price!”
Reviews.Author: ketchyshuby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while in town last month. With such reasonable prices I really wasn't expecting all that much. To my surprise though, the room was great (very clean) and all of the staff were very accommodating. Also, what a location! Middle of the city with a commuter station located right nearby! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dorm Room w/ Terrible Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: SCBlossom
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks were all very nice and very helpful. The location was perfect - just 1/2 block from the T-Line and about 2 blocks from my meetings. The rooms are noisy and the construction work across the street begins promptly at 7 A.M.! The bathroom looked like a hospital room and the room was small with no desk or writing table but was ok. We thought the sheets looked dirty but were not sure until we pulled the covers back and they had been turned over with lipstick and mascara (not washed!) on the end by our feet!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: sharpe_emma
Reviews.Content: My sister and I are in our early twenties and decided to take a trip to the United states for the first time, stopping in Boston 5 days and then onto New York for another 5 days. We were very nervous about booking this hotel, I was worried we would be far from our friends who we were travelling with and who had decided to stay in the Howard Johnson, but Hotel 140 was more than we could have hoped for, it was wonderful, the staff so helpful and the room so lovely and clean, we had a great time, and after a busy day exploring the city, we looked forward to coming back to it, cannot recommend it more! Through booking with expedia it wasmuch cheaper than staying in the howard johnson and right in the middle of Boston City, we were right beside the John Hancock building, so once we found the hotel we never lost are way.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure in the Middle of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: alexagal
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay! Everything was just perfect and the price was even better. It was a what we wanted -- a quiet, clean, non-chain feel and a great price. The pristine new lobby with old building charm was a great welcome. The front desk was very helpful and knew their stuff! It's just steps from Copley Place and Newbury Street! Wonderful experience and a great weekend getaway for me and my husband. We highly recommend it. Kudos to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Only consider if under $120/night.”
Reviews.Author: 1KeeneTraveler
Reviews.Content: While the location is great and the staff friendly and helpful, the room was all Y and no boutique. A permanent (I assume) resident next door had a home stereo that sent booming bass and techno pulsing through the walls beginning at 7:20am. The room had a linoleum tiled floor, basic oak dorm-like furniture and the shower was too tiny to work very well. If you get a super low rate (under $120, maybe), this location may be enough enticement. Otherwise, I'd skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping fully dressed on top of the bed, while listening to next door's music”
Reviews.Author: cramd
Reviews.Content: I was sure I was in the wrong place during my first trip around the block. When I stopped to ask a fellow who was cleaning the front of the YWCA if he knew where the "hotel" was he answered.. RIGHT HERE.. I should have kept on walking. The front desk was pleasant, but that is where it stopped. Up the lift to my floor I felt something was wrong. The lift's doors open to a hallway that could have come out of an 80's school horror film, which in turn lead to a door that did not look like it should lead to a hotel room, but to a cleaning closet/office. The room was sparse to say the least. First things that I noticed were: a) no carpet anywhere b) a tiny double bed c) ceiling tiles that reminded me of an old office The washroom was large, but I did not feel that anything was clean, even though I did not want to be in the room without shoes on. In fact I slept on top of the bed fully dressed for the duration of my stay. If you are looking for affordable lodging in Boston, and are not looking for anything above 2 stars this might be a fit for you. If you are used to something above these standards move along!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 140-worth a try”
Reviews.Author: redman709
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel 140 for 3 nights in early October. We first read about the Hotel 140 in travel books and then read the reviews. We decided to give it a try. Our experience there was just the opposite of some of the other reviewers.. We had trouble locating the hotel but just called and they guided us right to the front door. We checked in on a Saturday and had the nicest staff (man a woman) check us in. The rooms and bed are small but the room was very clean. The location in the Back Bay can't be beat-public transportation is close. Any questions we had for the front desk were answered thouroughly. This isn't your 5 star hotel with a pool and spa but if you are looking for affordable accomodations in the heart of Boston this the place. If you plan on spending all day in your room this isn't the place. If you plan on being gone and seeing Boston and have a limited budget, this is the place. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest room but it shows”
Reviews.Author: winterzodiac
Reviews.Content: I used all the big name online travel discount sites and this hotel came back as the cheapest for that weekend with decent reviews. It was difficult to find, as the hotel is unmarked since it shares it's space with a YWCA. I kept walking in circles because I could believe the YWCA was the correct location. I booked a 2 bed suite, but when I arrived, they informed me that none were available so I had to settle for a single bed. My cell phone didn't work in Boston that weekend, so I could call expedia.com about it. The room was extremely cramped, basically just fit the bed, the dresser/tv and a nightstand. The bathroom was tiny. These things didn't bother me that much since I'm from NYC, so am used to tight quarters. My main concern was that I saw and killed at least 3 bugs (not roaches...maybe bed bugs?) on the bed. I asked about using the internet and there was only one, so you needed to keep asking if it was open. POSITIVES: It was very centrally located and I could walk to everywhere I needed easily. They did have a cafeteria style breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: PATraveller88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lacking in every way. The hotel is unmarked; I had to ask a meter maid outside if this was the right building. It is shared with a YWCA; I'm here on a business trip, but instead of being around other business people - or even families - I'm sharing space with a youth hostel. The hotel room space is adequate for a business trip, except that the bed is too small, the "desk' is too small for even my modest laptop, the ironing board is a tabletop model (but there's no table!), there is no carpeting, and there is insufficient lighting. Walking back to my hotel at 10:00 at night - not that late, on a weeknight - I did not feel the least bit safe. I will ensure that my company, who booked this room for me, never send another employee to this property. For only a few dollars more, any other option would be preferable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: hawkdoc06
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Boston. We were supposed to stay here 3 nights but it was so terrible we moved. This place is not a hotel - it is a glorified rooming house. There is not a menu of services in the rooms, because the hotel offers very little in the way of service. The rooms are small. The largest bed they have in the hotel is a full. The TV's are small as are the bathrooms. The showers are so small you can hardly get the shower head arranged so the water actually goes over you. We had to change rooms multiple times because the AC wasn't working, then they put two of us in a room with a single bed. They finally moved us to a floor where loud music was playing until 2 AM. The only scenario in which this might be a good place to stay is if you are staying in Boston for an extended time and need a cheap, conveniently located place to sleep. It is far from luxurious - the linens were cheap and not in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “The very basic Hotel 140”
Reviews.Author: gemflanagan
Reviews.Content: Last summer my boyfriend and I spent 2 nights in the Hotel 140 and I'm sorry to say that we didnt enjoy our stay there. The location was great, very central to everything, however the hotel was like an old hospital or something that had been converted into a very basic hotel. Our room was tiny and the bed was more like a single than a double, and was very uncomfortable. We were very disappointed with the lack of staff available to take our queries, on a number of occasions we went to the front desk, looking for safety deposit boxes, tourist directions to different attractions, etc. and we either found the front desk empty or with somebody who hadn't a word of English and who couldn't help us at all. This 'hotel' seemed more like a hostel to us and we were glad that we had only 2 nights booked to stay here. On the plus side it was clean and very convienient to the local attractions. We had to depend a LOT on our guide books and the good will of locals in the street for things to see and do in Boston as the staff at the Hotel 140 were very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cfreiberg84
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. For the price and location, you can't beat it. We stayed on the 7th floor. It was a smaller room, but ample enough space for everything. We had a double bed, which wasn't bad and a nice bathroom. Great location, right by the T and close to Boylston St. I was actually impressed with the hotel. Considering it was a chain, I thought it would be rather hokey, but it was great. The beds were comfy, there is a restaurant downstairs that serves breakfast and lunch, and you are walking distance to just about everything. If you prefer a luxory hotel I suppose this isn't for you, but it sure beats a Hampton Inn or other typical chain hands down. We had a great time and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone heading downtown Boston. Back Bay is a really good area.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but Inexpensive with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bluesfld
Reviews.Content: These rooms are VERY small, like a dorm room with a bathroom. What makes this hotel worthwhile is it's location and the cost; it is half the cost of the next cheapest hotel in the city center, and this location allows you to walk to Boston Common, Copley Square, Theatre district, Fenway, and much much more. The room was clean; staff friendly; we did not find it noisy but, we travel with a noise cancelling machine. The shower (no tub) is quirky in that there is NO shelving anywhere to put shampoo, soap, whatever??? The trick, for not flooding the bathroom is to turn the volume all the way down, then adjust the temp, then get in before readjusting the volume. We stayed at the Hotel 140 two nights and figure we saved over $300 to spend on other aspects of our vacation. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: OriginalAchmed
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is really good. It places in the middle of the town. It closes to everything especially subway. By the way, the room we rent was very small as other reviews said. Our room had one window which opened to the construction site. Then, the view was not that impressive. Also the shower area was even worse. It's small. Conversely, the hotel was renovated, so it is very new & clean. Staff was nice especially the aunty at the lobby. :-) I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lantana19
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here for about a week and it was a so so experience. The room where we stayed, on the 8th floor, was VERY tiny. I'm willing to admit that this is somewhat normal for moderately priced hotel rooms in the Northeast but this room was smaller than my freshman dorm at college and that's saying something. The bed was not much bigger than a twin but moderately comfortable. The pillows was average and the towels were very scratchy. My room had a small carpet but otherwise linoleum flooring, wasn't very comfortable on the feet in the mornings. The bathroom was extremely small, the shower was barely big enough for one person and the showerhead was completely caked over in calcium deposits. The shower doors also leaked quite a bit which soaked the floor. The shower also has not where for you to place any toiletries so you have to place them all on the shower floor and bend over to use anything which is extremely uncomfortable. Showerhead caddies would be very beneficial. Was somewhat quiet and conveniently located. It was $20 a day to park a car in the adjacent garage. It was just a so so experience. I think I might look for another option if I go back to Boston.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel 140
HotelInfo.Address: 140 Clarendon Street, Boston, MA 02116
